Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fresh fish
Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster salad sandwich

bmb_TMfl3A82Ofnv7Xb2pg.text: The sushi here is super fresh and all sorts of delicious!   Between the four of us, we split about 11-12 rolls, 2 appetizers, and 3 desserts, along with a bottle of sake + 3 coffees. The total ended up being a little over $50/person (tip included), so it is kinda pricey, but we definitely enjoyed our food, and service was great. They were also friendly with substitutions/alterations, which, as of late, is pretty rare, so that was definitely appreciated!  I can't eat seafood other than fish and I don't drink alcohol, so I can only speak for the... -Edamame appetizer (super tasty, with sesame oil + red pepper flakes) -Vegetable Risotto appetizer (very flavorful!) -Green Fuji Roll (let's face it, I love and adore anything with salmon + avocado) -Fantasy Roll (tuna + avocado goodness!) -Spicy Salmon / Yellowtail / Tuna rolls (it's spicy fish with asparagus! :] I liked the extra crunch!)  There was also a lot of love at my table for the Mango Mariachi(?) roll.   The 3 desserts we had consisted of a cheesecake, a bananas fosters-type dessert with phyllo pastry and homemade peanut butter whipped cream, and a s'mores dessert. The s'mores dessert was a little too sweet for my taste, and the cheesecake was good, but not the best I've ever had. Of the three, the bananas foster was most definitely the crowd favorite, and disappeared almost instantaneously!

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Green Fuji, Spicy Salmon &amp; Fantasy Rolls!
Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

eOiFonxgRdgKQKHptm7plQ.text: BEST fish place in Pittsburgh by far. Penn Ave Fish Company has the best fish sandwiches. My husband & I have been going here for years and have tried most of their fish sandwiches, all of them are fantastic! We have never gotten a bad or even so so meal from this restaurant.  I have tried their sushi just a couple times & it is some of the best in Pittsburgh too. So fresh! If you have family or friends from out of town visiting & you're looking for a nice restaurant to take them too, Penn Ave Fish Company is perfect. We have taken almost everyone who comes to visit to this restaurant & they all love it too! Another plus (at least for me) is they have outside tables you can eat at with your dogs.  This place is a must try ASAP!

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cod wrap

JvAGw6vITqQfinGJzEVyEw.text: I loved this place and would definitely become a regular if I lived here. We came here given the stellar reviews on Yelp and it certainly lived up to the hype.  The crab sliders were legit. They didn't blow my mind or anything, but they were everything I expected and then some, especially with the yummy cold slaw and the awesome pasta.  The flower girl and pretty lady rolls were spot on. They have so much to choose from, but if you are looking for two rolls these are definitely two you can't go wrong with!

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pretty lady roll and flower girl roll
Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Delicious crab sliders

dyR_mmxa0dVG6myzms8QhA.text: Great place for sushi in the strip district. Everything served was so fresh. I also ordered a seaweed salad which was excellent. We came her for lunch and there wasn't a long wait. The inside is so bright, it was nice

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

U_dGks9bLfiYrLsjAK3LaQ.text: The price here beats out any other seafood place I've gone to. Ordered 2 sandwiches- the yellow tuna and Sneaky Pete. The portion of fish on each sandwich is substantial compared to others. The downside is that I ordered these medium rare and they came out medium to medium well, which dried out the fish some in my opinion.   Also ordered 3 fish tacos and I honestly didn't care for them too much. The combination of fish is what drew me toward them, but they were dry and lacked flavor.   Would definitely want to try here again if they cooked the fish as ordered. Service was also pretty slow, especially since there weren't many other people in at the time.

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sneaky Pete in the front, fish tacos, and yellow tuna.

H_WhAe4tCzyP68ALKKoOHQ.text: Everything was so delicious, I don't even know where they find such fresh seafood near Pittsburgh but this restaurant definitely does! Their green dragon roll was bomb and they were very generous with the portion size. Their lobster tail ramen was quite disappointing though.. soggy noodles, no flavor. Probably the worst thing on their menu, but all the other food was so excellent it definitely made up for it! I've moved away from Pittsburgh, but if I'm ever back in town and trying to have a nice dinner - I'll be back at Penn Ave!

UdCHZL1TwW9OhVogPL-3PQ.text: Descent and good prices.  I was expecting more.  It was only fish tacos and sushi being served.  Sushi was good, fish tacos eh.....would like to go back when there is a full menu available.

4enqbR6XWMubA2YyxOhNKA.text: Great place to get fresh fish and sushi for a reasonable price! Also, it's a BYOB!  We only ordered sushi and sashimi, but I want to go back to try a fish sandwich or tacos because their menu had a great variety of fish and flavor combos. Cod, salmon, tuna, tilapia, swordfish and more.  The price is right for sushi here, especially compared to some other places I've been in the city.   I was a little surprised by the Specialty rolls. I was hoping for a selection that was a little more raw and exotic, but most rolls were pretty basic or had things I try to stay away from when ordering sushi like shrimp tempura or cream cheese.   Next time, I'll probably stick with a mix of sashimi and handrolls to get a better experience of the amazingly fresh fish they have. Can't wait to get back and try more!

67kuFhmkTHL-3kyB_q0dkg.text: We have gone here several times for the amazing sushi, most recently over the weekend for a friend's birthday. Penn Ave has an amazing staff -they are wonderful with their private parties - very attentive, friendly and accommodating -they were great about decor, cake and BYOB wine for the party.  I can honestly say that I have never had bad service here- or bad sushi for that matter. Penn Ave has some of the FRESHEST sushi in the city, if not THE freshest in the city. If you love sushi, you must come here at least once to experience it.   The only thing about Penn Ave is just that its a bit pricey, but again you are paying for the freshness and quality of the fish, so it is worth what you are paying for the food. However, their bar prices are a tad over the top for me- paying 8.00 for a Corona is a bit on the ridiculous side in my opinion. But the good news is that Penn Ave is BYOB on wine so pay a small cork fee and drink up - this is what I do every time I come here.   Favorites are their specialty Benny Roll, Dragon Roll, and Calamari appetizer with red spicy tomato sauce, olives and crusty bread. So delish!

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Specialty Benny Roll and California Roll.

M9ZTGeWW5YsGqE0DJuuz6g.text: Caught the Saturday happy hour (4 to 6, same as Wed-Fri). Great $1 oysters. BYO. Didn't get one, but the fish sandwiches look huge and are reasonably priced.

oASRHqa1Ozs-I1m6Z_Ozvw.text: Very nice atmosphere and staff is knowledgeable. We had a quick dinner. I really enjoyed the salad bar and the soups were fantastic as well. I had the fish tacos which were good but I don't think I'd order them again. I'd try the sushi and salad bar next time I come back.

18x-lZ6y7eytI4EhrfljWg.text: Love Penn Ave fish for their signature PAFC salad and the freshest Maki roll around. They have the friendliest staff and the owner was so happy to chat when I mentioned I was recreating the salad for dinner. Salad comes loaded with hearts of palm, Edamame, tomatoes, cucumbers, and a nice added touch with some jalapeno kettle chips. You can top it with any piece of fish. Definite crowd pleaser, you always see patrons ordering the salad. You order at the counter and service is always quick. They draw a crazy lunch crowd so be expected to wait a bit.

chu_P917YjN4TWqGLasfAw.text: Wonderful place to get seafood for lunch! The place has a small fish market in the back and table and chairs in the front. They have a large selection of fish sandwiches and other seafood items. I chose the fish tacos with swordfish, tuna, and salmon. They were delicious! I especially liked the salmon. I also tried their sushi roll of the day. Again, very delicious and fresh. It had shrimp tempura on the inside and a grilled piece of salmon on top. Their soups are freshly made. I came at a time when their soups were almost sold out and the one they had left was the spicy seafood gumbo. It was still very delicious, flavorful, and filling. This is definitely one of my favorite spots in the Strip  Apparently they have unlimited fish tacos for $8.99 on Tuesdays. Only found out about this after I left Pittsburgh. D:

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spicy Seafood Gumbo
Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Passionfruit Ginger Ale
Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

aEwSML_-mMsW-M1s3T1jIg.text: I leave here with the same sentiments every time....the sushi is the best part.   Hooked on the pretty girl roll!   Anyway, ordered fish tacos and sneaky Pete's because I remembered them being good two times ago.   Sneaky Petes and its side of day was wasabi-ful, and I'm not a fan.   The fish tacos were good, and that is that.  I think they put too much salsa on top.   As for the sushi, the pretty girl roll and philly roll just melted in your mouth as good sushi should :).  Try the sandwiches, but honestly, the sushi is prob the best in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Small portions but Melt-in-your-mouth-good!
Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sneaky Petes.....too much wasabi everywhere for me.
Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fish tacos

n_QxG9vn-QvRDY8ZLNW7dA.text: Best sea food in Pittsburgh fresh, great price, and nice staff must go. We came here for late lunch they have unique payment style "honor style" eat what ever you want and pay as you leave. They have salad and soup bar. Sushi which did not try yet but sure it is as good as the rest of their food

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Best salmon medium well and tasty
Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tuna sandwich

KYmn6xbOaZmKRi9zzTmxXQ.text: I had to decide whether to have dinner here or at Wholey's. Only one if them serves Leona's ice cream sandwiches. LOL It was our first time eating there. We weren't sure where to sit. Half looks like a fish market with tables and half looks like a restaurant. We went in the market side. The young lady at the counter explained that we could sit anywhere and that we could order there or table side. We asked for recommendations. Her name was Brenda and she was very helpful.  We took a seat and checked out the menus. There was a sushi menu, a specials menu, and a regular menu. Honestly it all sounded good. I decided to go with her recommendation.  I ordered the Crab Stuffed Grey Sole with a side of  asparagus. There were two pieces of fish stuffed with crab. Yum!  But it also had a sauce that resembled a Lobster Bisque.  OMGosh!!!  I could have licked my plate. The side of asparagus had been grilled and was also very good.  My hubby ordered Mussels. These were bigger than the ones we get at the beach. Instead of a white wine, butter, and garlic sauce these had a tomato based sauce. The hubby said he liked those more than the ones he gets at the beach. That is saying a lot.  Obviously I had a Leona's ice cream sandwich for dessert. In fact I got two to take home.  This is a great place and I will def be back to try more!  FYI-it's BYOB!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crab Stuffed Grey Sole
Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mussels

P0zP7mgoCBM3EqI9xQCkVg.text: I love coming in to the Penn Ave Fish Company when I am walking the Strip. They have the freshest sushi in the city, and I would be afraid if they didn't. I always order the same thing:  Manhattan clam chowder Crab cake sandwich  Tekka Don Tuna Roll  The cooked foods are always for my friend while the sushi is for me. What can I say, I like tuna more than I probably should considering the over-fishing that is going on.

9-fLSR1IFFa14LbVnnESOg.text: Whether it's their fish sandwiches or sushi, Penn Ave Fish Co. provides fresh fish and delicious food. The flavors are on point.  I can't really say anything else about this place. It's just honest, good fish. I can come here for a fried fish sandwich with fresh bread, for some of the freshest sushi, or for fish to bring home to cook.  Amazing.

dzawqUvqZspNeEhTKz17LQ.text: Best sushi I've had here, really fresh tasting. It's casual and the ordering and payment system was a little confusing the first time we went, but we will go out of our way to eat there again.

_dqTlKPq79K6Jxi6VqZfaw.text: Food is first rate !   Soups are great and the crabmeat tacos are to die for !   The smoked salmon cannot be beat !    So many choices !!  The employees working here are not only knowledgable but first rate friendly !!!    5 stars NO DOUBT!!   Been there about twenty times!!!

1V5hDMZqwtrS8lioHd47Pg.text: I'm going make this review simple. I love this place. The service is a cool order at the counter and they deliver it. The staff knows there fish too. I went with another special...Wild Bill's Buffalo Salmon burger. Hot sauce, blue cheese and celery on a fresh roll with a mammoth piece of Salmon.  You get a few fresh made sides....check the picture. I bet I have eaten here 2 dozen times and never repeated a order. The sushi is great too. You have to try this place if you love fish. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Wild Bill&#39;s Salmon burger

CAXZXLlJTl1VgDMi8tJbTQ.text: Came here for dinner once because it was so hyped up and I have to say it is a pretty interesting venue. Consider it a fish market and restaurant in one. Not as nice as an actual restaurant because you can smell raw fish since it's out in the open. Layout of the restaurant is a bit confusing as well and not as clear to someone who has never been there. I tried a decked-out salmon sandwich there with avocado and an assortment of other additions, and it was a decent sandwich. Didn't blow my mind, but it was good and filling. I feel like this is one of those homey, "Pittsburgh staples" that is pretty fun to visit and has decent food; don't expect a Michelin star experience, of course.

_1rGywHfA6Z3pExHbvjn4A.text: I really enjoyed coming to Penn Ave if a bit on the pricier side. We ordered the crab cake sliders, which you get three of. They needed a bit more crab, but the pretzel buns they came in were really tasty. I also had the blue point oysters which were big and creamy. They had a clean taste and didn't deal with any grit issues. The place gets really busy, even on a weekday which is the only downside...and finding parking in the strip district. Otherwise I would love to come back again for all the other options they have, because they have many..I just need to bring more money next time :)

fyOi1DNT3emGfN6H_N8Wfg.text: A classic place with great, reasonable food that has not adjusted to the "scaling" issues of the Strip District.  The Strip District has gotten crowded... really crowded. With the influx of new people, places like Penn Ave Fish Company are able to shine with their amazing food.. but with a cost.  That cost is an operation which is frankly poorly done and hopelessly confusing and inefficient. It needs to be updated.   Why do I order from one counter, get my food, sit down and eat, then pay at another counter right next to the one where I ordered at the end of the meal when there isn't any real waiter/waitress service? And you can't get your check at the table. And everyone's confused about which line is which (order vs pay). And the food can be very slow, because I think this place is taking on a few too many customers when it can't handle the demand.  Once they figure this out I'll go back. But until then they need to get their operations in check. It does not work for lunch in its current state. Too slow and too confusing.  I ordered sushi for lunch and was told it would take 45 minutes. 1 hour and 15 minutes later... no food. Me and several others from my party ended up leaving without any food.   So as much as I love the food here, which is incredible, I hope they improve their operations.

NgUu_IxIN19MdV1h_7p9mg.text: I got two fish tacos (one soft shell and one hard shell) to go with their Tuesday taco promotion. The fish was good except that I still felt some of them were dry. I guess I just liked salmon more than the other two. The sauce was good, but somehow I felt it didn't stand out.  The fish they sell seem so fresh that I'd like to come back to try their other dishes.

-OjrEfhUm2l7cC5LRNiIPQ.text: Stopped in for a fish-fix for the weekend and couldn't have a happier tummy!  My wife and I split a salmon salad and we also sampled the mixed seafood tacos. Everything was perfectly prepared and we took home some smoked salmon for tomorrow- sublime experience. Wanted to share a pic but we eat it all before I got a chance!  Can't lose here...

cgemnFQ-QFb9gM16mYtyBQ.text: I had the Asiago bisque with ham and salmon unbelievably good soup  Who could think of such a wonderful combination! And Bread crumb English cod on ciabatta bread excellent!  The food is fresh , clean and healthy  Wish they were open for dinner!?? Hopefully in the future

KRbM_6mpWuW4Yhjf2tcL7w.text: Definitely some of the best sushi in Pittsburgh. Just walking into the building, you are welcomed by the aroma of fresh fish. If that smell doesn't fill your olfactory with the promise of good food, try some other place.

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

LE6ronn7_6s80SglC2_qEA.text: Loved the food here.  Fresh, beautrfully prepared seafood.  Always delicious.

GeyYeUH_2lhAselTmeZuRQ.text: Amazing sushi--super fresh! I'm moving to Pittsburgh area eventually and plan to be a frequent customer.

yQO4-Qz0yqQrYFVIh8Niow.text: Checked this place out for lunch.  They lost our order so we were there for a while.  Food was okay but kinda expensive for lunch plates and for the quality.  Prob won't go back.

tjCtJTx6kkxW5ggvfURZHQ.text: Solid prices and excellent fish, especially for a landlocked region. Casual service in an environment reminiscent of a warehouse, but in a good way. I'll be sure to remember this place the next time I'm in town.

qLJ4trsGiWd7_6tAp-Z5RQ.text: I don't know why I don't come here more often when I visit from NYC! This place has expanded into the space next door so you don't ever have to worry about a wait! This time we had the crab cake sandwich which was delicious. There was more crab meat than breading which makes it a lot healthier.  The ciabatta bread was also fresh - crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside. Even the cole slaw was awesome. We also had the Benny roll which was amazing.  The shrimp tempura was freshly fried and the salmon was lightly seared as I had requested. Totally rivals places in NY!

9PRV7iOfS3s-twBPsinj6g.text: The crab cake sandwich was fantastic with mostly crab and not a ton of breading and additions. The bread and aioli rounded it out perfectly. The lobster bisque had big chunks of lobster and was rich and creamy. I love that they don't skimp on their seafood portions! The spicy tuna roll was very fresh and I definitely want to come back and try more of their raw offerings.

9xsQGCuvNsqc7uTmjYq7DA.text: This is where you come when you want the freshest seafood in Pittsburgh. But I am having the energy plate which includes seaweed salad and snapper. I always come here but I know I want the best seafood.

26c9UANy4wqULF4xEKNycQ.text: Didn't like it. Found it to be highly overrated. Small portion, the seafood was fishy and not at all representative of the freshness that this restaurant boasts. That, coupled with the busy atmosphere, long wait, and less than stellar customer service, left me feeling underwhelmed. I have yet to return, and probably won't although I work near by and frequent other restaurants in the area...

OPpgYd_Uvj72AOoTAb2hrQ.text: A really good experience.   Everything was fresh. I had the cherry stones and some sushi.  The staff was personable and delightful.  I'll happily return.

NePatw1hYwuJ73qQjRyLHw.text: First time and it won't be my last. Great food. Great atmosphere. Great service! Ask for Susan. She'll walk you through an amazing food experience!

gU2EDCY8sY9Q3zyTnARSOg.text: Amazing cod parmesan sandwich! Never thought the buns could make such a difference until I took a bite on that ciabatta bread bun. Everything was fresh and tasty. We weren't planning on getting dessert at first but the ice cream sandwich menu looked too good to not try. And I'm so glad we did because it turned out to be the best ice cream sandwich I've ever had in my life...

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ice cream sandwich, sesame flavored.

yXPogpqHLJ0xcQiYUrpWFg.text: Crab melt and roasted salmon sandwich!! The strip is always a good time for food and this was my first time here.  Nothing else to say other than yes yes yes! I don't eat a lot of fish or any for that matter in sandwich form lol.  So this was just tasty to all the levels and my hunger was thoroughly satisfied here.

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

VgVHgV5gokfCjnvOoMIp4w.text: I've been coming here for years for fish and music, thought they deserve a review. They play some crazy EDM on Saturday mornings, I feel it's just for me, cause apparently, one look, and it's clear, I'm still drunk from the night before.  You feel transported to some fish market on the Pacific coast, only your not, you're 38, reeeeally hungover, single, and eating near a river in a town that's famous for putting a burial mound of fries and coleslaw on a pallet of bologna.   Everything's great and the fish gumbo and Happy Jack sandwich are soul cleansing.

uAWS-OXtoqa7HO4dwv8KJQ.text: Hands down the best sushi in Pittsburgh! I went here last night with 2 of my friends. The place was packed because there was a rehearsal dinner next door, but we were able to score the high top table in the front. We ordered the pretty girl, the benny roll, the green Fuji, and the Boston roll. They were all delish, but may favorite was the pretty girl. For desert we had a leona's ice cream sandwich which is never a disappointment.  We brought 2 bottles of wine, ate 4 rolls, and had an ice cream sandwich and each paid $20. What a great price for great sushi!  Get here!

34TkFHmIEeiFc6l0DUmVjw.text: I'm most familiar with Penn Ave Fish Company from the downtown location so I was excited to finally visit the original location in the Strip. But this location didn't quite do it for me. I prefer the downtown location.   First of all, the Penn Ave location is not just a restaurant but it's also a store where you can buy fish. I didn't know that until walking in. So the half on the left side has the dining room tables and sushi bar. The right side has the cashier counter, some refrigerators of drinks, freezers with frozen seafood, coolers with whole fresh fish, additional tables and the kitchen in the back. So it's confusing at first when you walk in because no one is there to tell you where you can sit. Neither is there a sign. This is how I understood it to work: you can either sit down wherever you'd like and a server will come get your order or you can just order at the counter and pick a seat. You can even wander around the whole place undetected as that's what happened to us. I wish I read Angie K.'s Yelp review prior to coming here as she outlines exactly how this place works.   Anyway, the food here didn't seem consistent to the downtown location. I ordered the Unagi Don (BBQ eel bowl) and it didn't come in a bowl; it came on a plate. The downtown location use to put it in a bowl with seaweed salad and ginger which gives it some nice variety with the addition of seaweed salad. This location only gives you the rice and eel, with wasabi and ginger. My husband got fish tacos and our friend ordered the Ronnie Roll and the Shrimp and Crab Pizza. The pizza, I was told, had a nice crust.   With the sushi bar in the left half and the kitchen in the right half, there was no communication between the two and our food did not come out consistently. The warm items came out first and the sushi didn't come out until my husband and our friend already finished eating their tacos and pizza which meant I had to agonizingly watch them eat while I waited for my Unagi Don. Also, the service was slow since there were only two people working the front counter. Like I said, we went undetected for quite some time. For a Saturday night, it might be beneficial to staff more people.   I would probably order take out from here, because the food still tastes alright. The confusion and poor service just left a bad taste in my mouth.

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Unagi Don

qBmg1Df9E-62DlsSwBNTeg.text: Great food and great service. Try their sushi and oysters and mussels. Everything was great! Can't wait to be back

xj63GcHy8bDxCPENfSPwiA.text: This is like Chelsea market NY meets small town downtown!  Loved it!   It's a fish market that sells sandwiches to sushi   The fish sandwich is amazing, perfectly breaded and fried and cooked! The tarter sauce was on point and prices were good! Very laid back atmosphere where you just order a la carte and pay at the end!

MZMa0rjPDEZ3gpFDzUtuMA.text: Came here for oyster happy hour with a co-worker last night, and to be honest this was my first (good) experience with them.  I've never been a huge fan of oysters, but my boss swore by them and he has a great track record thus far of recommending the best restaurants.  These oysters were fresh without tasting overly fishy, absolutely delicious.  They had two kinds, east and west coast, if I had to choose one over the other I'd go with the east coast as these seemed meatier.  We also ordered sushi for dinner, and I've had a great experience in the past with their fish quality, having bought sushi grade fish for my own making.  Definitely recommend stopping by here for an awesome dinner!

JIL1KbQDNziRE4A1BvcQcw.text: Really delicious food.  The concept here is basic and so is the ambiance.  Its an open space with some tables and chairs. You order at the counter and then they bring your food to you.   The fish was amazing. I.had a basic breaded cod. So fresh and delicious.

uaBlq_UyGNSLxU0FD3CwnQ.text: As far as fresh fish goes in Pittsburgh, you can't do much better than Penn Ave Fish Co without breaking the bank. They may not have the best sushi rice in Pittsburgh, but if what you care about is the quality of the fish, this is good bang for your buck.  I am hooked on their Johnny Boy rolls, which I get as takeout with some regularity.  The space has a very open, modern atmosphere accented with cheesy seafood-themed decor that is sure to put a smile on your face. The staff are super friendly!  While I was waiting for my sushi one time, one of the guys behind the counter introduced himself and let me sample a fresh-shucked oyster.  They deliver through Postmates, which is a plus!  If this were situated in a city like Boston or Seattle, I'm not sure it would be worthy of 4 stars. But, for a non-seafoodie town, it's a solid choice.

pQwqfy7dH9J3rnyXYyrN9A.text: This place has some seriously tasty sushi.  It was super fresh and reasonably priced.  They had some kind of psychedelic trance music playing that I was actually digging too, but Don't worry it's not overly loud where you can't hear your dining companion. With friendly employees and tons of bottled beverage options to wash down your sushi you really can't go wrong.   Don't miss out if you're in the Strip District!

rx__aDAb6zfzGMjiccRb1A.text: I've never had fresher sushi than at Penn Ave. The amount of fish in the roll was so plentiful. They have a hot and cold bar for take-out, which I browsed and found there to be some tempting soup options.   We sat at a high top table in the dining room and although it took our food awhile to come out, it was worth every second of the wait. My favorite was the shrimp tempura roll, which was warm to taste and I was told frying this roll this was the reason for the wait. I would have loved to try some of their sandwiches on the menu. My eyes followed every single plate that came out, making notes of what to try on my next trip here.   Some things that kept it 4 stars instead of 5: a waitress held food in one hand and sprayed a table to clean with the other, long wait for our food to come out, also I wasn't a fan of the decor (I don't think they have much of a theme), and lastly, I felt rushed while ordering, due to the ordering procedure. I wish they had the sushi on the board as well to make it a quicker ordering process, instead of looking at the taped menu on the counter. Nevertheless, the quality outweighs the quantity at Penn Ave. I hope to try out the downtown location, next.

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cali roll and shrimp tempura roll
Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tuna and avocado, and tuna and yellowtail

leW-PfkCfcqDB2w1qWhhIw.text: Favorite lunch spot for sit down or take out! I absolutely adore this place and thought about giving 4 stars because they're always out of soup when I get there!!! But the food is so wonderful I couldn't. Was also skeptical of fish in Pittsburgh but am totally comfortable eating it here!  The fish is always fresh and service is fast. The setup is overwhelming for someone like me who can't make decisions on the spot because everything looks so good, but I always resort to my go to-the crab melt. The fish tacos are also good, and the chirashi bowl is a generous portion of fresh fish. Great food for a great price! You can also watch the hip and stylish men clean and cut huge slabs of fish while you eat, cool entertainment.

2l7upAriB-0vdgW4aZ69xg.text: My boyfriend and I came here expecting a good dinner for lent only to find out they were only serving 2 things on their menu. So we decided to just order sushi. The waitress failed to tell us what we ordered only came with 2 pieces...that's 4 pieces of sushi each. Not an ideal dinner. Sushi was very good but not enough and came to $30 total for only a small amount. We had to leave and find food else where. We were very disappointed by the lack of communication and lack of menu choices.

IWctgGUO6BvZTI11Idwlkg.text: Great spot for a quick lunch or if you want to pick up some fresh seafood. Since my boyfriend and I were tourists, we didn't get to do the latter but at least we got to enjoy some of the cooked food!  Their most popular sammie is the Sneaky Pete (grilled salmon on whole grain ciabatta wth arugula, avocado, hearts of palm, and spicy avocado cream sauce). They ask how well you want to cook your salmon. We asked for rare but that was really medium. I wish they had taken it off the grill sooner but even as medium, the sandwich was really good. The salmon tasted fresh.  We also had some of the crab tacos (seasoned lump crab meat in a hard taco shell topped with cabbage, cilantro salsa and sriracha). You can also opt for soft tacos if you'd like. I wasn't expecting there to be a lot of crab meat but there was a good amount. The cabbage tasted really refreshing with the tacos.  If you can't decide on one of the many food options in the Strip District, I'll make it easy for you. Skip Primanti Bros. and check out this place instead. It's cheap, fresh and delicious - three words that don't often go together.

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crab tacos
Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sneaky Pete - their most popular Sammie. Grilled salmon on whole grain ciabatta wth arugula, avocado, hearts of palm

O0xt6-rbjXWO_jGcZuuFTg.text: The positive reviews on TripAdvisor,  Google maps and Yelp convinced us to walk the length of the strip from the convention center to try this place out. At first glance it did not seem like much more than a seafood market/deli.  No fancy tables or franchise decorations.  Don't let that deter you.  The food tasted Great and most importantly... Fresh.  The self serve soup was also quite yummy.    They played chill music and the ladies working at the counter were sweet and helpful.  Lastly, the prices are very affordable when compared to the nearby seafood restaurants.   If I lived in Pittsburgh,  I could see myself eating lunch here often.

tzbW5KzbKfRo9_roFmw6GA.text: This is my first time using yelp because the fish tacos I just had were that good.  I love fish tacos and have had them all across the country. The fish tacos here are the best I have had. They come with perfectly seasoned/cooked Tuna, Swordfish,  and Salmon on each taco. If you want an unbelievable fish taco in Pittsburgh then head to Penn Ave Fish Co. In addition to the great food, the atmosphere and service was great. Food came promptly after ordering. If you're not a fish taco fan, the Swordfish sandwich looked to die for.

hKrAR88Du5VNzQwBG6B8DA.text: Funky little place with great fish. We stopped by after touring the district and sampled their sushi. The rice was a bit overcooked, but the incredibly fresh fish and avocado more than made up for the rice. The ambiance is one of sitting in a market whilst eating sushi. So, don't expect a romantic dinner experience. The staff is very friendly and they offered me a sample of their ACME smoked salmon when I asked about it. Very tasty salmon and with a great texture.

N8aKq4a7rAu-YbYHFlK0YQ.text: YUM YUM YUM in my TUM TUM TUM!   That is definitely the phrase I use when I go to Penn Ave Fish. The smell is not overbearing like some other fish places and the atmosphere is completely different than what you are normally used to for a restaurant.   For both locations the sushi is Divine and you will leave feeling ridiculously full and satisfied. You can't help but smile when eating the sushi, and the random specials of the day also make you excited to see what surprise special is next!   Both locations get ridiculously busy during lunch hour so be prepared to be there for a little bit between 12-1pm.   Another recommendation is the shrimp and crab pizza. (As I was typing the food my mouth started to drool a little). It is a thin crusted pizza with a bit of a kick to it.   I can't rave enough about this place, and would recommend it to ANY sushi lover of Pittsburgh.

x7Tp_3sQO--Jr4K52AwFUg.text: Best lunch spot within the downtown Pittsburgh area.  Salads, sandwiches and sushi are all top notch with the freshest fish possible.  You can truly taste and see a difference in the fish.    Try their Jalapeno Ahi sandwich, do not leave without trying the pretty girl roll and if you are up for it the fresh oysters are tremendous.  If you aren't hungry at the moment stop here to pick up fresh seafood to prepare at home.  Wholey's and Benkowitz cannot compare to the freshness and selection of this place.  If i could give 6 stars i would

mRwHRg8kCv0n1rXKigvwEg.text: Everything here is really fresh and tasty. Great twists on sushi rolls (with jalapeno, citrus and the like) and brunch classics. Grilled scallop salad, South Beach snapper and California tuna sandwich are some of my favorites. Great soup as well.

YLfhH7i-uUsxOjt2q6jYNw.text: [upgrading my review to 5 stars after last trip - incredible and interesting sushi special and a big honkin oyster on the house when I rolled over and started chatting to the dude behind the giant fish on ice]  When you have a craving for fresh fish or sushi in Pittsburgh you cannot go wrong with a trip to the Penn Avenue Fish Company.  They have such an excellent menu of various fish sandwiches and sushi.  Today I went there for lunch and went for the Fish Taco Tuesday special.  The fish tacos were very good - not great like other menu items.  I am a little disappointed that I did not try something new and adventerous since this was my 4th or 5th visit there.  They need to do something a little different with the setup of this place.  Not horrible but the seating could have a better lay-out and the order/payment lines are a little chaotic.  I definitely plan on going back sometime soon.  I need to try the clam chowder and/or salmon sandwich or classic engish style fish sandwich or the sushi.  Highly recommended.

HulThZYmuEqc3K8cxWKIog.text: If you want the freshest and best Sushi in the city, Penn Ave Fish is the place to go.  The atmosphere is very casual, and you are very likely to see someone behind the counter in a shiny smock cutting up fish.  The hours are limited, but their new Downtown location may help with that problem.  I have been to 2 special dinners there at the Penn Ave location, and both were over the top.  This place has the best Sushi in town, hands down.

qTZDV_45PfP34Fi2R6o3ZQ.text: Checked this place out today after hearing good things on Urbanspoon and enjoyed the food immensely.  I got the crab tacos and thought they were pretty good. The crab was kind of underwhelmed with everything else but the cabbage was crisp and flavorful and the tomatoes had this deep red color to them and tasted really good (I usually don't like tomatoes). The srircha sauce that it advertised was actually a mixture of the sauce with sour cream. I think it went well with the tacos. I also got a bowl of clam chowder soup that was very tasty. The stock was thinner than I'm use to but still as flavorful. It was a little light on clams, though and had a lot of potato.  I'm definitely bringing my mom and dad to this place the next time they come down. They both enjoy seafood, especially the way it's prepared at Penn Avenue. They also love sushi and will probably be happy to see that predominately on their menu.

Y1s7AtoVbDGcHH34OW00jQ.text: If someone told me I could only eat sandwiches from one place for the rest of my life, I would make it Penn Avenue Fish Company.    They're just astronomically delicious.  I've never been disappointed.    It's always a little hectic inside, though, which I don't like much... they could have more in the way of seating, especially comfortable, organized seating.  But I realize that's not really the point of the place.

WI9S7tN0HM04PVt0IkOmEA.text: When we walked in, we were confused on the protocol of being seated and ordering. Aside from that slight confusion, the food was fantastic!! I got the crabcake sliders and they were yummy. Very fresh, quality food. And the decor is beautiful-I felt like I was in a cool underwater world. The place was very clean and well maintained. I'd return!

YwPD5wvhMQt2I5_hJbzVyg.text: Fish and seafood are freshly made with good ingredients. The quality of the seafood is great here.

RIcFfG6bHAYHPJKU36EnzQ.text: This is a staple for lunch for my office. The spicy tuna and pretty girl rolls are amazing. Highly recommend the Sneaky Pete sandwich.  Regretfully, for the first time, my office got food poisoning after our various orders of salmon sushi. Ugh

F3-T1vVgCCx50-7PON62Dw.text: Penn avenue fish is a really cool spot! I tried the english cod sandwich and also the fish tacos. Both were delicious but I prefer the cod sandwich at Wholey's which is just a few blocks away. However, the fish tacos were outstanding! They also sell fresh seafood and sushi!

M--N6tircGERzdkYIqgLjA.text: The best sushi in Pittsburgh!   Especially like the sexy senorita roll.  Our favorite Sunday spot for BYOB Bloody Mary's (they provide the mixers), oysters, sushi and them some awesome fish to make at home for dinner.  The fish here is the freshest and they hand trim it all.  They will even recommend recipes. Simply the best fish in Pittsburgh!

WsZdKvSaSUBxlyiQ1tl3oA.text: The dude making my sushi had a dirty band-aide dangling from his finger.  We told the manager, who talked to the guy.  Our sushi was remade with the dirty band-aide still on his finger but not dangling.  Disgusting.

taETaUovsLmFMdk5QBgy_A.text: I love this place. Hipster fish and sushi.   Their soups are phenomenal.  Its a perfect place for lunch.  For pittsburgh being pretty far from a ocean this joint got awesome  fresh fishes all the time.

a4lyMqmFqLWuaTulnGn7-g.text: Just okay. I had the fish tacos. Fish was fresh and tasted great but  the other ingredients lacked flavor. Ended up using a ton of red hot. People at the counter were nice. Set up is kind of confusing. Part deli, part restaurant, part sushi bar. I am still not sure if you sit down and someone will take your order or you always go to the counter.

5kETWSudzdgYD_eezcpDMA.text: Summary: Penn Ave Fish Co is a shit show as a business and at least some of their food can keep the people coming. Service is terribly slow and the servers are clueless. It looked like a madhouse. One of the owners (Harry or Henry??) kept flirting with me and it made me uncomfortable because he is definitely at least 45 and I'm 18 lol. It didn't help that I kept catching him looking at me while I was eating..  When I first went to Penn Ave Fish Co, I immediately thought, "This place is a shit show." There was a blatant disorganization between the kitchen and the front of the house. In fact, there was even miscommunication amongst the servers themselves.   When I received some of my food (they forgot the sushi), my server had went to go retrieve one of the other servers because she "didn't know which one it was." It just seemed like the servers were relatively clueless and would only say what they thought you wanted to hear in this awful whiny baby voice. And does anyone think it's weird that all the servers are girls? I guess if making your servers show their  bare chests brings you business then so be it. The Hooters of Fish joints, let me tell you.   The service was terribly slow but at least the food was kind of good. I got the Sanjaya Swordfish which was a little dry and bland but the sushi made up for it. I got a sexy senorita roll which I highly recommend. The yellowtail tasted fresh. I also had a side of pasta salad and it was too vinegary. Hardly finished the first bite.   I had the chance to talk to one of the owners (Harry or Henry??) and he honestly made me feel a little bit uncomfortable. He came over to my table of three and it just felt like he was hovering over me too closely. At first, I thought it was just me and then my two brothers said it felt like he kept checking me out even after he left left the table. What a creep job! He even winked at me too when I left.   Maybe I'll get take-out sometime but definitely not dining in ever again.

Hq4bPp3lVMrb0Vzl_AYmzA.text: Very disappointed with my visit to Penn Ave Fish Company (downtown) this week.    Have greatly enjoyed the food and friendly service at this location in the past.  Visited on Monday and my bill was $5 higher than expected, but I hadn't asked for a receipt and drink prices weren't quoted so thought maybe my ice tea was the reason.    Looking for good fish, again today, a Friday in Lent.  Only to be overcharged again.  I asked for a recipe in hopes it would help me to understand.  The price listed on the recipe did not match the prices on the menu board.  When I questioned it, the cashier informed me that their price went up yesterday, but they haven't had time to update their signage yet.  My suggestion that I be charged the advertised price was met with a shoulder shug and her continuing to take the next order.  Not sure if the employees are skimming or if the company is purposely charging their customer's dollars over their posted prices, but be warned...

HUVbPzH3p_FOalJLueowmQ.text: Dude.  Writers block.    Legit Seafood Legit Service Legit Sabor  I'm creating the SSS Bureau as a result of this visit.    So during lunchtime it's crowded.  Expect co-workers to push 3-4 dining tables together so you will be limited in the seating arrangement.  There are tables outside, and if it wasn't sub 0 and if you want your food chilled in 10 seconds...well outside isn't an option.    I can't speak for the sushi.  But what I did consume were the black-end fish tacos and the oysters.  They have a portable gas grill that they grill to order.  My guesstimate is that they are the local wholesaler and whatever they don't sell they cook.  Quite ingenieous if you ask me.    Btw...my  mind ISN'T in the gutter, but their logo is quite provocative.    I'm just say'in.

hHMvLJwdJwrgX7bzMEayrA.text: it's just ok. Not a huge fan of their sushi or taco. They do have decent fish sandwich tho.

UaEzRWcgL-J-mpgtoednJw.text: I've heard so many positive reviews about the sushi from this place so I have been eager to try it myself.  I went here for lunch with a friend and we ordered the following:  Flower Roll Pretty Girl Roll Spicy Senorita Roll  I felt like this was enough food for the two of us.  I was content without being sick to my stomach full.  I enjoyed all the rolls - they were fantastic.  But I'd have to say that I was partial to the pretty girl roll and the spicy senorita roll.    But I would probably order all three again.  This was really great sushi - fresh and tasty.  I didn't give this place 5 stars only b/c of the hours.  It's really inconvenient if you work and don't work close to the Strip.  The only reason I was able to experience the deliciousness was b/c my friend was kind enough to pick me up and take me there.    I know they are open on Saturdays so it's an option, but it would be awesome if this place was open for dinner!    I'd like to go back, but it'll take some planning.

3UMejlGZg8VjTwT7UEVmTw.text: I was super pumped to check this place out as I had been having a craving for a beer battered fish sandwich and fries. I picked my boyfriend up from his place of employment and we headed over to the Strip District location.  I love the feel of this place. I don't know why as the decor makes no sense lol, but I guess it makes me think/feel like I'm at one of my favorite fish shops back in Florida. I ordered the English-style cod sandwich and my boyfriend ordered the yellowfin tuna teriyaki sandwich. I must say, they gave him a mighty nice looking piece of tuna. He ordered it rare and said they cooked it pretty well.  My cod was also super tasty.  The fish was nice and light and flaky, though I could have done with a heavier batter. And alas, no fries. Just a side of pasta and slaw, neither of which were to my liking. I also was not a fan of cod on the ciabatta. It's the bread they serve all of their sandwiches on, but I felt like it conflicted taste-wise too much with my cod.  We did not try any sushi, but seeing as everyone says it's one of the best in town we'll probably be back to give it a shot. The locations are so convenient and overall it was not bad eats.

O0s-fenj0yP-qU7S2obJgA.text: I had the Tilapia sandwich and it was pretty good. Good atmosphere and great service! Friend had the crab tacos and she loved them! Good place to stop before a Pirates game.

SgpPo2AFUMAn8SJmtVwVgQ.text: I never hat to pay for the sushi here because my work always paid for it so its easy to say 5 stars haha.  The sushi is very good though.  One of my favorites in Pittsburgh.

V-PLgkHoiKs882WqM0SWlA.text: Fish is so fresh, food is great.  Had the soup and sushi for lunch.  Not only is it a cute place to eat, but it doubles as a fish market.  Would definitely recommend for buying fish to go, or sitting for a meal. Located in the busy Strip district of Pittsburgh with lots of shopping opportunity. Definitely worth stopping here during a day out!
