0u4ocVVav9Zy8MNrTjmJAw.text: Had the Baja cod wrap.  Fresh, delicious, reasonable prices, great music, hip atmosphere, friendly service.  What else can one ask for?

vF0wy_9I5Chk13BsBk9j9A.text: I had thoroughly enjoyed the food and hospitality in Pittsburgh until I came here.  This place should be avoided.  Terrible service, weak menu (including the sushi menu), bad atmosphere, clearly not very fresh fish, and dirty.  So many other fantastic places in pittsburgh.  It makes absolutely no sense for this place to be rated as high as it is.

A2ZVWqnF2pJJ0VohGcVakQ.text: best sushi and clam chow in da burgh

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. best Sushi and clam chow in da burgh

Kw6JniaHWJxve59aPf2H0Q.text: Ok - let's start with the "waitress" who was wearing her gym attire (as in biking shorts & sports bra)...yeah, I really didn't want her hands on my plate. Maybe she is not a paid employee & just a college student with nothing to do on a Thursday evening.  Still not who I want bringing my food. I asked the girl at the counter for a recommendation, since this was my first time here.  She said, "We're known for our fish tacos..."  Ummmm....I have no idea WHY!!  They had zero flavor and were absolutely nothing to write home about.  Kaya's fish tacos blow those out of the water (slight pun there).  My boyfriend had the swordfish salad - also something not worth even discussing.   I saw all the great reviews....and I feel like I wasn't even at the same place.  Odd, but True story.   My boyfriend, the nice guy he is, left a tip...what for!!!??? I took it and bought a real taco at El Burro on my way home.   I love fish and usually get my fix at Luke Wholey's Wild Alaskan Grille (just one block down from this place)...that's where I'll continue going.

HyPe_3Z6GVh35Qw9X9X7Bw.text: Decent sushi is so hard to come by in Pittsburgh.  I guess that's what makes Penn Ave Fish Company just that much better!  Before we ordered, we headed to the back of the restaurant to check out their fresh fish for sale.  They had a good assortment of fresh fishes, and shellfish as well as the most beautiful scallops I've seen in a while (but ran around $23 a pound... =/)  I ended up ordering sashimi lunch platter and a scallop pizza to split.  The sashimi platter came with three pieces of salmon, four pieces of tuna, five pieces of fluke, three pieces of octopus and two pieces of crab.  The fish was some of the freshest fish I've had in Pittsburgh.  The crab was forgettable, but all the other pieces were absolutely melt-in-your-mouth delicious.  Originally I was going to just get the sashimi platter and my companion was going to just have a maki combination, but we saw that lots of people were eating the scallop pizza so we decided to get one too!  The pizza was like a "white pizza" and came topped with sliced scallops, cheese, tomatoes as well as some rosemary.  The scallops were super tasty and brought an otherwise mediocre pizza to a whole new level.  I really like how the staff is really cheerful as well as the incredible prices!  My sashimi platter with 15 pieces of sashimi (and two pieces of crab) was just under $10, my friend's maki combination was under $7, and the scallop pizza was also just under $10.  It was definitely more than enough to fill me up.

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Seaweed Salad
Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Green Fuji Roll, Salmon and Unagi Nigiri

iIJtVYabvXcUsp3EzM_thA.text: I have no idea how this place hasn't been reviewed on here yet. It's very "yelp"....feeling like it was plucked off a street in Seattle or San Francisco.   The front consists of a large amount of glass so the natural sunlight and slick track lighting light up the big open warehouse style space. Lots of aluminum accents and polished concrete give this a very clean, modern feel. On the right of you are the different counters where you order sushi, sandwiches or  fresh fish from the market. There is also a counter that you pay at after you eat (it's all on the honor system). The music is at a good volume on a great sound system with some good bass. Very chill deep house and loungey drum and bass fill the room. A nice sophisticated touch.  In the middle is a narrow strip of tables running about half the length of the building. This place gets CROWDED during the lunch hours so make sure you come early, late, or don't mind battling for space to eat.   Now onto the food. This is the freshest sushi I've had in Pittsburgh so far (haven't made it to Umi yet), and still up there with stuff you'd find in a coastal city. Makes sense, because you can literally see them cleaning and prepping all of their fish at the next counter down . Everything literally melts in your mouth. Nothing is dry, chewy or fishy, even with salmon. It's great. They also get a little creative with their sushi dishes, usually having something different each day. My personal favorite is the Spicy Senorita Roll, with Yellowtail, Jalapenos and Cilantro. Awesome! Make sure you check out the combos and larger plates they have if you have more than one person.  I haven't honestly tried anything else other than the fresh soups (they usually have about 4 daily, and they're all incredible). The sandwiches look great though, so I can't wait to try them. The crabcakes are gigantic - those are first on my list.  So if you're like me and have been looking for a fast-casual style sushi counter/fish market in Pittsburgh, this is your place. The only improvement I could see here would be more seating....maybe a rooftop deck would be a good idea.

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

NT0cG6E3y7g3HpN0VK5r7g.text: After seeing Wholey's, and surveying a bunch of sushi places throughout Pittsburgh, I had given up on the prospects of good seafood in Pittsburgh. I was proven wrong.  Everything on Penn Ave Fish Company's menu is awesome. The sushi is easily the best I've had in Pittsburgh and pretty much anything I've ever had here impressed me. Even if you're not a fan of the menu, the fish is undeniably fresh. I'll be back again and again!

6efPog3jXHTi7iDYQ8-qwA.text: Cod sandwich for lunch was very good. Quick service and didn't wait long for our meal. Will definitely return.

pKms2vUn02rBRQ7Obk7QTw.text: Complete ripoff. I really hate when reviewers mention they had sushi but leave out the most important details. Went here and had Salmon Sushi Rolls (4.25 + tax each). Sounds like a good deal, right? Think again. These rolls were MINUSCULE and still even only had six pieces instead of eight. The rice was not even on the outside. What kind of half-assed place doesn't even bother with the little extra effort to do that?  Meanwhile, the whole restaurant/shop smelled extremely fishy (think fish tank that hasn't been cleaned in 3 years) and I personally saw flies landing on the fish that a guy was cutting up when he would walk away to grab something. Uhhhh... nasty!   They've also discontinued the all-you-can-eat sushi Wednesdays citing the Tokyo Nuclear incident as the reason. Really? But buying rolls piecewise is okay? Shouldn't the shop shut down if they are so concerned?  And finally, I am not sure if this next point is a positive or a negative for readers, but I will mention it in case anyone finds it informative: the cashier/waitresses all have these low-cut tops where their anatomy is nearly falling out. Personally I prefer to eat at restaurants that don't have to rely on the harlot card to gain business, but that's just me.

cZ7RWku16vdiQC7krLY62w.text: Sandwiches are to die for! Wish their hours were modified so it would remain open longer.

51NqT3QQF0nllRbaoqQzoA.text: I'm a huge oyster fan, but have been hesitant about trying oysters here in Pittsburgh, since we're landlocked and I was concerned about food poisoning. I have to say the oysters at Penn Ave Fish Co. are amazing! They are fresh and full of flavor. It was easy to distinguish between the different types of oysters (there were 5 different kinds). I thought they could have cleaned/shucked them a little better, but overall I was delighted by the quality.  That being said, my sushi menu experience was mediocre. I tried the unagi don, pretty girl roll, and tuna/salmon sashimi. The unagi itself was overcooked, and the sauce was a bit too thick and the flavor wasn't quite there. The rice was dry and over-seasoned. The whole dish was topped with slices of avocado, which was unexpected. The pretty girl roll was a little bland, but the fish to rice ratio was excellent, and I enjoyed it overall. I loved the tuna sashimi but the salmon didn't taste as fresh.  I would return to this place to try more of their non-sushi dishes, or more of their sashimi. Their sushi menu seems Americanized, and I prefer Japanese sushi.

sXVGOqZSV5cry8C0fOhf6w.text: This review is for the fish tacos. The freshness of the fish was drowned in the seasoning. I like my fish tacos with a single type of fish rather than a mix and larger pieces rather than chunks. the cole slaw was good.

cuF2yOlxvTaOXs0UPcnUSA.text: The Strip is cool.  Sushi is cool.  Sushi in the Strip is really cool and the Penn Ave Fish Co. knows their fish. Watch as they carve fresh fish for sale and/or your next sushi platter.  Excellent quality, great staff, highly recommend as tops for Sushi in Pittsburgh!

spHsSn4Mo72-MgjL7D4nCQ.text: The people here are really nice. We went there at around 7 and there were plenty of seats. I love the fish taco with hard shell. It is tomato on top with fried fish. The bread for the soft taco is a little over burned though. My friend seems to enjoy his cod + crab burger a lot. But i can taste a sour smell going through my nose. I don't know why. In a nutshell, this is a nice place with PARKING space(not very large). We will definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cod sandwitch
Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fish taco

kdjwjlufcM-YniyN4rFgtg.text: Today was my first stop in and it won't be my last! They have good prices and fresh fish! Not only do they have sandwiches and sushi, but they also have a fish counter in the back to purchase whole fillets. You also have the option of picking out your own fish from the counter to put on your sandwich for an upcharge.  All the sandwiches come with two sides with the option of chips, coleslaw, pasta salad, beets or green beans. I tried the crab melt, and the green dragon roll both were delicious and came in good portions. The food came out fast and the service was friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

HAoMEwXRBY968CicmrqGsg.text: I've been to Penn Ave Fish Co twice and I can't wait to go back! Brunch, soup, sushi...it's all so good!  On visit one I went with the soup and salad bar. It's a weigh and pay method and it was a bit confusing to find the scale and the employees just leave you to it...we never did find the printer so we wrote the weights on a napkin! There were 2 soup options: one was cream based with crab and one had salmon with tomato base. I tried both and they were both so flavorful and rich. The salad bar was small and I don't remember anything remarkable about it. We also ordered salmon sushi and it was perfect.  On my second visit I went with the smoked salmon benedict. The poached egg was perfectly cooked with a soft and velvety yolk. I relished every bite. The tasty home fries side was cheesy and thus was very heavy and greasy. I could have done without the mayonnaise cole slaw it came with. I would prefer a green salad to complement the heavy potatoes and rich eggs.  The atmosphere is fish market meets deli. There are tables in the market area and also near the buffet in an adjoining room. With metal chairs on a hard floor it can get loud in there.   I still crave that salmon benedict and I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Salmon benedict

pCWvClMMgltcxuG_kPVdNg.text: Dang! One of my fave seafood spots in PGH. If you love no nonsense fresh fish, you'll dig it too. It's got a relaxed atmosphere that'll make you feel like you're right on the dock. Not sure why Yelp has this as $$, it's actually very affordable for a seafood place. Love it!

NeRU3vHm_DZltwMr_OrNSQ.text: When looking for freshness, Penn Avenue fish company is the best.   The fishmongers will help you and guide you through any process that you may need assistance for purchasing.   Their sushi is probably the best - hands down, in the city and surrounding Pittsburgh neighborhoods.   Not only buying fresh fish here but also the restaurant and the daily soup bar is always a bonus. Food comes out quick, presentation is always on point, the menu is extensive and will cover everybody's palate. They do have their liquor license so you could grab a beer. But that menu is limited. I would still BYOB for your favorite.   Ask about having a sushi rolling party for your business or get a group of friends together. A great way to spend time with one another and have a great Epicurean experience!!  They have expanded the restaurant and also have a parking lot, so if you're coming down for lunch, most likely try to grab a spot in the lot, if not there is street parking.

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fresh Fish Daily
Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Senorita Roll
Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fish Tacos

wG1A0MMqjxnSCybrmlnTBg.text: My face place to eat fish and buy fish in the strip district. This place never disappoints!

XT8NRO9dYTazlum20Oilgw.text: This place has it all, atmosphere, amazing food and a great location.  Best sushi in Pittsburgh, try the Chirashi Sushi Bowl, OMG!

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chirashi Sushi Bowl

21rN6t953qFQcs--FgIZeg.text: The food was so fresh and delicious! It's one if the few places that has Copper River Salmon when it's in season. The food was prepared perfectly- the salmon was the right temperature, the mushrooms were savory and the beans and greens were wonderful accents. The service was great, and the food came out in a timely manner. Love that it's a byob place. I would definitely go back to try more!

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Alaskan Copper River King Salmon

rvx4Mpr7YSyNr4nSWkfMxw.text: We went here for fish tacos.   They had hot sauce on them.   Not to our liking.  It sort of killed the taste of the fish.   The best fish tacos I have had are at Round Corner Catina in Lawrenceville .

enfpctA0ZR8b654SZTaNuw.text: Still 5 years after all these years !  If I could give them 6, I would !  I recently got married and they did our catering. Everyone raved about the food !  Zero issues and zero stress. I just love this place and the owners Angela and Henry.

GWYncfAk7Xiob-hk1IjxGg.text: This was our first and last visit! We asked for a table outside, the table was filthy and the server asked if we'd like to have it cleaned off! Well, yes! She came back and sprayed cleaner and wiped half of the table and left the other side filthy! We ordered, and both fish dishes were ok, I asked for a soda, didn't realize I had to go inside to get it, then asked for a glass, which you need to get as well! Pretty pricey for small servings and bad service!

_aY-xa9iV5J4rTiBEYBVOg.text: Great spot if you're looking for some seafood or sushi! Where else but where they carry fresh fish. This is a relaxing, open, sunlit place with plenty of tables for couples or families or groups. Lots of different specialty rolls with generous amounts of fish. Or you can go for the traditional rolls. If sushi isn't your thing, they have fish tacos and a variety of fish sandwiches. Prices are very reasonable. BYOB if you want to drink wine or other.

WWYmGBhiSd4wy_3dOANE8Q.text: Very casual atmosphere.  Very good snapper with seaweed salad and asparagus.  Just the right seasonings.  Delicious.  The fish tacos were a little bland but good. Service was very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

OLAu-9Uwt8OIGSkpFyoc9A.text: Excellent Lobster Bisque.  Great sushi (as per my wife). Lobster sandwich on a pretzel roll was excellent as well.  Weird music combination, but you dont eat that, so....

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sushi Bar

mUYQlOS9d-KDUFdw9R7g-g.text: Being in Pittsburgh you might assume that our seafood game is weak, but Penn Ave is a nice surprise to prove you wrong! I've eaten here several times (both dine-in and take-out), and it's a go-to if I'm craving some fresh sushi, crab, swordfish, tuna, salmon, you name it.  The dilemma of whether to order sushi or one of the seafood items from the menu is a serious problem for me. Problems like these are my favorite, because no matter what I'll be happy. It's a given when I order sushi that one of the rolls I get will be a Philly roll, but you can't go wrong ordering anything else from Penn Ave's menu. The sushi is rolled fresh in the back dining area of the restaurant, and they feature a special roll on the menu board at the front counter where you walk in.  Just recently I was here for lunch with my mom and my boyfriend, and we all ordered different sandwiches. I got the crab melt and crossed my fingers that it was going to make me happier than sushi would have that day. Thankfully after I took a bite I was relieved that I made the right choice, and my lunch guests were happy with their choices, too. The only complaint would be that after being offered soup from the soup and salad bar we were not made aware that it was an additional charge. The seafood gumbo I had was great, but not necessarily something I would've opted for knowing that it was going to be an extra $3.99. Overall I'd put Penn Ave in my list of favorite lunch spots, so if you are a seafood fan I'm sure you'll feel the same!

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crab melt with slaw and pasta salad!

33rXzlOSqfvvqcJmd_l0XA.text: Fresh fish to take home = 5 stars Lunch = 4 stars (sides are lacking) Dinner = 1 (poor selection, poor sides, $5.00 BYOB charge!)  I will continue to buy my fish here, but I will never eat here again.   The fish is good, but you are eating in a garage with 1 dinner fish selection. Salad bar is served in plastic containers charged by the pound. Cole slaw and pasta salad are the sides. I spent $20.00 for a fish sandwich and a small serving of coleslaw and rice/beans. You have got to be kidding me!

Gq7Pit7dvkB1WL2k13g9gA.text: Great little sit-down option on The Strip.  The Penn Cove poke bowl was simply delicious and I loved the addition of macadamia nuts!  Clean bathrooms, nearby valet lot, and friendly service... what's not to love?    Looking forward to trying more menu items when we're back in town!

y4B3dOe0AJH3rIXU-vzvsg.text: I see all these other great review and I must have just ordered the wrong thing. Take it from me and don't get the sushi. Everything about it was weird and off-which is not what you want from your sushi. The spicy tuna was odd and subpar, the salmon sushi was a weird cut, chewy, and room temperature, and all the special rolls we ordered just tasted like a bunch of cilantro. Also I mean I get it because it's a fish company but the whole place smells really bad. And they started taking out the garbage and rolling it by us when we were eating. All in all a truly odd and terrible experience

D1ck3_ZEDhExEGZLK8XF6Q.text: Fresh salmon and oysters!! Very mild in taste!! Service was exceptional!! Highly recommend!!

UeqyqfQA-RUS4TqA07xJyw.text: Excellent seafood The freshest and best available in Pittsburgh They also have a restaurant in the same location which serves sushi raw clams oysters and cooked seafood dishes which are  delicious Highly Recommended !  Added bonus BYOB !

7nBKDLohh8UuAlB28rjRhQ.text: Laid back ambience. Fresh fish. Great sushi. The sea bass soup was delicious. Generous portions of fish in the soup. The sea bass entree had a great presentation and was equally delectable. Would recommend this place for a casual, good quality meal at a good price. Don't forget it's BYOB so bring your favorite wine or beer!

eCaV6t-kMxXtiejpAAuz4Q.text: This is one of my favorite lunch venues in Pittsburgh. They have terrific fresh fish sandwiches and the absolute best coleslaw around. I highly recommend Penn Ave Fish Co.

-o1vhY0WTslSnXb6IumTNQ.text: I got the fish taco and it was okay. I was also disappointed by the service. I called in to get a to go and was told that it would take about 5-10min. I drove in the restaurant 5min layer, and waited for another 15 min for my food.

slm5B0BOGqRyXCRQ3sCBMQ.text: I can't believe I haven't reviewed this gem of a place yet. With the freshest fish in the city and the best sushi and the city, it's sure to be a place you'll find yourself back at again and again once you start.  If you are the type that mingles with the staff, they'll let you know when they'll get the next 170lb yellowfin tuna in! Perfect for taking home and making your own sushi with.   But if you aren't feeling so creative, you can check out their selection of sushi. I don't know if I can recommend a specific roll because they are all so good. But, if you are into hot things, try out one of their (I think it's called ) Dragon rolls - topped with one of my favs, Sriracha sauce.  Not one for the raw stuff? That's fine. Try out the scallop pizza, or fish tacos. Both make me weak in the knees. Perhaps you are picky about your fish? That's fine, go on to the back and pick out the cut you want. They'll grill up anything they have for you, right there.   Staff is totally knowledgable and friendly. I go twice a month and they always remember me. If you pick their brain about the fish you can get some pointers on how to cut it, how to prepare it, all kinds of stuff. Oh, and this place totally works on the honor system. You tell them what you ordered when you leave. For some it is confusing, but I find it nice to order and not worry about the check until I am ready. Great for lunch.   I am telling you... you MUST check this place out. Don't bother with Wholey's, especially if you are looking for sushi meat!

jWVgHWB_sufh1Yfea-NDGw.text: Great place for seafood! So Fresh and inexpensive. Service is wonderful :D my best  lunch experience in first time pittsburgh.

orvAM4m7BFW87NTgWccj0Q.text: LOVE the nautical and ambient atmosphere! The owners are GREAT people! Sushi rolls and fish were extremely fresh. Selection was excellent. Overall hands down best place in the strip for sushi! Their other items on the menu looked great too, but I can only say I had 4 of their rolls. California, yummy, and one other. Sue at the front is very helpful and extremely sweet! Must stop by and check out if you're in the area looking for fresh seafood with a good dining atmosphere. :)

9mk8J9bCRLfeDy4PfPqa_g.text: Truly the best smoked salmon you can get anywhere.  All of the seafood is so fresh and high quality at very reasonable prices.  And a great place to have lunch every time I'm in the Strip.  And the branzino is outstanding - their employees are very friendly and the fishmongers are so helpful.

MY5nrX1-GCZt_tqUqKemcw.text: Just ate here yesterday, and I still love this place just as much as I did the last time! Crab Melt is the way to go with a MASH soda :)

rEzp4SLuKOEfHOkUFk5uBw.text: I rarely ever say this but, I could have used a little more food...  I came here for brunch Sunday morning with my brunch club *shoutout* and ended up getting the lobster and egg burrito.  It was great!  Huge chunks of lobster in the lobster salad offset with the warm scrambled eggs made me very happy.  A little too heavy on the arugula for my taste.  However, once I tasted my friends platter from the All-you-can-eat fish taco bar I had some serious buyers remorse.  So fresh from the fish to the veggies and slaw on top.  I hear great things about the sushi too.  It's next on the list.    -Order at the counter, grab a drink from the cooler and have a seat.  They bring your food to you! -Not a ton of seating  Dang, seriously considering fish tacos for lunch now....

tKEA9TONtAx791MH5JTT8w.text: Being curious as I hadn't tried this place yet I ventured in on a Saturday afternoon. I ordered the Sanjaya Swordfish Sandwich which I found to be excellent. The service was good but I felt they were a tad standoffish. The venue is nicely laid out and they were playing some deep house music which created an interesting mood. I'd say overall I liked this place and would certainly come again to try the other items on their menu.

sPDRVQ_bRiNBtGq0A8JWag.text: I grew up on Cape Cod. I am a fish snob. If it isn't ridiculously fresh, I'm disappointed.  Penn Ave is the real deal. Got the lunch sushi special. Delicious. We sat near the soup bar, and it all looked good I had to try it. Had the watermelon gazpacho - amazing. Was still hungry, so I also got some seafood chowder/bisque that was equally delicious.  I didn't want to leave, but I was full, and I had places to go. If you're into fish and you're in Pittsburgh, go here. You won't be disappointed.

TKDTnPpYmfUO9V_Teage3A.text: I was pleasantly surprised.  I went there on Sunday for the brunch.  I ordered a Salmon/Bacon/Cheese sandwich.  I like fish but I don't love it.  So I was not expecting much.  When I took that first bite of my sandwich, I couldn't believe how good it was.  My husband ordered a Tuna/sticky rice with egg and it was just as good as my sandwich.  I can't wait to go back to Pittsburgh.  Would love to eat there again.

KLguI-Wi1HvTdSNc5_UkOg.text: This place is pretty amazing. I do feel that it's a bit pricy for the level of service and atmosphere, but you can't deny the quality of the food. And the service is very good, there's just not a whole lot of it, since you order at a counter, pay at a register, and get your own drinks from a cooler. I tyically get sushi, but I've also had the best fried-fish sandwich of my life at this place.

798idmpvncYA8LcNdjpiFg.text: Energy lunch- salmon, green beans and ginger carrot salad rocked!  Get it!

jX_FlgihnIZyN2CWQZC4Xg.text: I came here for a weekday lunch. I ordered a crab melt which came with a side of coleslaw and pasta salad for $10.99. The amount of crab in the sandwich was on the skimpy side, but the taste was on point. You can tell all of the ingredients they use are super fresh!  Service was just okay. It seems as though this place gets really hectic around lunchtime...crowded around the front where you order and loud.

ZZ4sBl9MN9jgsNNU17EKLw.text: We arrived on Sunday around noon. We were very confused as to whether we should order at the counter or at our seats. After about ten minutes a friendly waitress told us she would be taking or order. She came back after about ten minutes and took or order. The food took very long to come (as did the check) and we were all non-plussed by it considering that it was quite expensive.  The atmosphere is very unwelcoming. It smells pretty bad of fish, the interior design is very sterile, and the music is way too loud and is not the kind of music you want to rock out to when you are spending 20 bucks for a sandwich with chips, a bowl of soup, and water.   The product seems okay, but they need to do some work on the overall "feel" of dining here. It would take a lot of convincing for me to come back here. I would definitely not recommend this place at this time.

2dnLbWEJYGtHFZCOLlfldw.text: I ate here this past weekend with my girlfriend and her parents for lunch.  The outside of this place fits into the neighborhood and looks like nothing special.  However, once you step inside though you soon realize that you are a pretty awesome place.  It is a full-fledged fish market complete with a good amount of whole fish as well as a deli type area and even a fish cleaning station where you can actually watch the workers clean fish at.  Most of the workers are also dressed the part with rubber coveralls that you would expect to see on a fishing boat out in the ocean.  The bathroom to the restaurant is in the back and you have to walk through the kitchen in order to get there which I found to be pretty cool.  The whole place is also decorated with fishing related items even including the bathroom which had at a fly rod inside of a case stuffed to the side of the wall.   The restaurant portion of this place is a confusing whenever you first walk though the door as there are seats strewn about everywhere with a chalkboard menu behind the cashier.  However, after asking a question to the girl behind the counter I was told that I could order at the counter and pick a seat of my choosing and pay at the end.  Since I had heard good things about the sushi here I decided to start off my meal with the Boston Roll and also went with the Broiled Cod Parmesan for my lunch entree.  It was only after I had ordered and sat down that I noticed a large soup station and became jealous that I did not order some.  My girlfriends parents ended up getting some, a chowder of sorts, and said that it was really good.  After waiting only a short time at the table my Boston Roll was served to me.  It was sliced into eight pieces and had the shrimp, avocado and cucumber on it as promised by the menu.  It tasted excellent and I felt like it was quite a refreshing dish and that it was a good starter for my meal.  Soon thereafter my fish sandwich came out with sides of both slaw and some type of deli salad that had chick peas in it.  I first took a bite of the cod removed from the sandwich in order to get its full flavor and found it to be pretty amazing.  The breadcrumbs gave it a rich crunchy buttery flavoring with the mild flavor of the fish coming through slightly.  After my first bite I was excited to try it on the sandwich as cheese and pasta sauce normally only make things better and whole doesn't love a good Ciabbata?  The bread was good but sadly I was disappointed that the sauce and cheese completely covered the delicate flavoring that I had enjoyed when tasting the fish alone.  Although I still enjoyed the rest of my sandwich I felt like it had the potential to be better.  The deli salad that came with it was also good and while I personally did not enjoy the slaw (slaw always seems to be such a personal taste) my girlfriend really did.  Overall though I really enjoyed my meal and loved the ambiance of this place.  The bottom line for me is that I will definitely be heading back here in the future.  As a matter of a fact just thinking about having some sushi along with a one of those good smelling soups is making my mouth water.

hMT-jpejvc9OWr3_kqFI_Q.text: Five stars because I wanted to order literally everything on the menu.  There wasn't one thing I wouldn't have eaten.  Since it was lunch, I stuck with a P.A.F.C. salad topped with salmon, and, because I just couldn't resist it--a cup of Boston clam chowder.    DELICIOUS, and so cool--they have all kinds of nautical art on the walls and hanging from the ceiling.  The menu is written/decorated on a chalk board, and you pay at the register when you're done eating.  I can't wait to go back and try everything.  I'm looking forward to sushi here...but seriously, I will try everything. Muahaha.

2kIz5ZuShNDs-h7CNVCf3A.text: Had the best meal here!!! Came for an early dinner on a Saturday. We were seated immediately with no wait. Then someone brought us an appetizer of miso glazed Chilean sea bass that was extra from their private party - it just melted in our mouths! The lobster roll was the best one I've ever eaten (pretzel bun FTW) and the sushi was also phenomenal. You can also buy fresh fish here so we got some Scottish Salmon to go! Amazing, relaxing, and one of the best dining experiences we've had in Pittsburgh in a while! Will definitely be back soon for lunch or early dinner!

kYLyWTKWda_0lZiB9sL2-Q.text: The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that it's rather loud. The food was excellent. I had the ahi tuna. As a warning to others, it was spicy. I like it spicy but some people might not. The tuna was perfectly medium rare. My daughter had the flower roll sushi and said it was delicious. I definitely recommend this place.

8n8o8E1E363JL5TqkSCQ1A.text: This was probably the best chirashi bowl I have ever had.  All the fish they selected was great, but my favorites were  the yellow tail and the red snapper because they tasted so buttery and flavorful. I can definitely tell they use fresh fish here and take excellent care of their inventory.  Sorry I was too impatient to eat that I forgot to take a picture of the entire bowl before starting.  I wolfed it down.   I would definitely eat there again. Too bad I don't live in PA :(((

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Exterior. They have outdoor seating and open air seating indoors (big windows open when weather is nice)
Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sushi chef station and fish market

boAogUyi4LR7GApvtuONDw.text: The fish is so fresh and the food is so good!!  This is a fish market that also serves food like sandwiches, sushi, and salads. I'm going to try buying seafood here next time - everything looked really fresh and the scallops I saw were HUGE   The way it works is you order your food at the counter, they bring it to you, and you pay at the counter at the end. Super friendly staff too.

VjqxOys6-jPLwbzg_LNOZA.text: The reactions of the passerby as they saw us eating here were priceless. I wanted to let them know that it tasted even better than it looked, but I was shy.   Street parking was easy on a Saturday night. When we arrived we realized there was a parking lot right next to it too.   This is the kind of place I like. It's got great food, but it's not pretentious, and it's casual dining. Prices were mid-to-high, but definitely worth it.   We had the Rosemary Scallop Pizza, Larry David, and the Squid Fries.  Fries: 7/10. They were decent. Not too much of anything, the sauces were as expected. The roasted red pepper sauce was better than expected.   Larry David: 9/10. It was a decent sandwich, but the BREAD took it above and beyond.   Rosemary Scallop Pizza: 10/10. The crust was buttery. It was golden all the way through, with minimal charring. It supported all the toppings, no problem, while staying thin. Cheese was great. Scallops were wonderfully blistered and buttery. Rosemary leaves added the roasted complexity I didn't even know it needed. You should have heard me as I was eating this.

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Squid Fries.
Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Larry David and Rosemary Scallop Pizza.

3pSeLTTKK-Rlty1gUAwqTw.text: WOW WOW WOW... whether you're just visiting Pitt (like me) or you're born and raised... you MUST visit this place. If I lived in Pittsburgh I would be here at least three times a week. Looks like this place is a vendor for restaurants but also carries a killer food dine-in menu.  I ordered the crab cake sandwich on ciabatta. This may have been one of if not the best crab cake I've ever had. The meat was flaky yet put together and the flavors were booming. It was seared to perfection and left a lingering taste in my mouth in which I think about often. My boyfriend ordered a fish sandwich and it was melt in your mouth good. It was very simple, however it didn't need to be anything beyond that.  I wish I found this place day one instead of last day because I would have stopped in again for lunch. What a wonderful experience!!

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

8_JeOKWi-itXzyynSr-ELg.text: Mixed review!  Dinner: I stopped here on a Friday evening for sushi, and to enjoy sitting outside. Luckily, I called ahead and the hostess told me that this restaurant is BYOB. Important stuff! The service and time for sushi was lacking. The sushi itself for dinners was very fresh, and good! I was also surprised by the amount of fish on the hand rolls.   12 hours passes, I'm in the strip on a hot day with my dog... might as well stop again. Surprise! No one serves you outside for lunch. I sat there for a few minutes and eventually called the restaurant to ask someone to bring me water and a menu (since I had my dog) All the items from dinner menu are not on the lunch menu(limited) so I was stuck getting sushi again. I don't eat much meat so I was kind of fished  out, when the "waitress" told me there was a vegetarian roll I was excited... then quickly disappointed. Total yuck. Absolute no flavor, no toppings, nothing. I know what you're thinking "that's what you get for getting a vegetarian roll" no! There are plenty of other sushi restaurants that have had amazing vegetarian rolls, and I have to say I wasn't the least bit impressed with this one.   Summary: dinner experience was lovely, lunch was not. I was a fan of the fresh fish, but service wise I would say there is some work that needs done there.

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Salad for lunch
Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dinner sushi menu

E3r5BXptxU2ja_Hj1uZwBg.text: They have a great selection of sandwiches and it's delicious. It's a casual set up, where you order at the counter but pay after you eat. The soups smelled delicious too, and I will have to try their lobster bisque next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

kh1XXvAPoyvOc4N8ww6-Xw.text: I am always so impressed and never disappointed by Penn Ave Fish Co. It's hard for me to deviate from my usual Sneaky Pete because it is truly THAT good. Everything is so fresh and fulfilling.   They have a choice of self-serve soups and additional sides which all look great, though I have not tried any of them.   You order at the front desk, they bring you your food (very fast service!), and then you pay up front after you are done eating. The restaurant even has its own small parking lot! One of my favorites in the strip!

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sneaky Pete - salmon, avocado, palm hearts, arugula, and hot sauce

UotPjWk8awZ1OgPZN7gc_A.text: Bada-BOOM! I've heard great things about Penn Ave Fish company sushi for years, but had never actually made the trip down to the Strip for that purpose. It wasn't until recently, when I was at an event they catered, that I realized just how good their quality of fish was and how skilled their sushi staff were in preparing it.  First off, things are a little different here - you go up to the register and place your order - then, the wait staff brings it to you. You get up and pay at the register after your meal - it's sort of a hybrid between a "fast food" style ordering situation and a sit-down restaurant. Nothing too off, just different from the norm.  Anyhow, the fish is suuuuper fresh, and you can really tell that the quality is far above most regular sushi joints. You never really wait too long, either - even when this place is packed, I have had great luck in getting our order quickly. While the ambience isn't your typical Japanese izakaya -style setting, it is really fun to enjoy delicious sushi here and listen to the classic rock that the staff likes to play. I never knew that Led Zeppelin and Boston would pair so well with my Unagi roll! Enjoy!

LrSstRs8HjmNiaL7W_rkWQ.text: Super casual place to get fresh and delicious fish! They offer a variety of options including tacos, sandwiches and sushi at a reasonable price!   We tend to opt for one of the sushi platters to have a little bit of everything.... this time we got platter D for $60. The salmon and yellow tail are amazing.   They offer many different soups and a salad bar at lunch.   They are byob... and we weren't charged for a corkage fee!   The food is great, but the service was sub par. It didn't take away from the experience but they certainly weren't going above and beyond.

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

FerNiCXHyqh8f2Q8jg9HCQ.text: What do you do when it's rainy, you and your friends are hungry and you're at the strip? You come here. Or at least you should.  The interior is very casual. You order off of the menu and they bring you the food to your table unless you get the soup - then you just get it yourself (I don't remember if it was unlimited or not).  Now, speaking of the menu - it is beyond extensive. It took me forever to pick something but I eventually settled on the Sneaky Pete sandwich with the help of the people working there and putting up with me. It was delicious and hit the spot. The salmon was perfect, especially coupled with the freshness of the arugula and the spicy creamy avocado sauce - not too spicy but not too bland. For $11.50 I was pleasantly full and lasted until dinner.  My friends got the crab cake sandwich for $11.50 and the clam chowder soup respectively. Neither of them had any complaints.  I'm definitely coming back here next time I'm in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crab Cake Sandwich, also recommended!
Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sneaky Pete - so so good!
Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Clam Chowder Soup

8-brR3LrDQp7aBa0J99A4Q.text: Really enjoyed my meal here for a quick lunch in the Strip District.   They have a great self-serve soup and salad bar that is in the main dining area. I highly recommend the she-crab soup. I could've had 10 bowls of this stuff! 5/5  For my main meal I tried the spicy tuna melt. So good and so fresh. There was a generous amount of tuna included and it was just the amount level of rich and fillings. Delicious and 4/5  Will definitely be back to try some of their famous sushi.

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spicy tuna melt!

c9UeEkobPCtvq3KPVS5YgQ.text: I always love going to this place whether its to eat, or to buy fish. I love the oysters - they are decently priced and fresh. They have a great happy hour on oysters - I believe its Thurs-Sat?   Sushi is great, tastes great, and I love the variety.  When buying fish, I found the staff to be knowledgable and helpful. Always tastes great. I love that they offer sushi grade fish for you to buy and take home.

xk3o3amKxb46r5_rUENNXw.text: Visited with my family, nice experience, very fresh sashimi and the happy hour oysters only costs $1 . I also ordered calamari bowl and cod sandwich, both delicious.  Only reason I didn't gave 5 stars was because the oysters were cheap but not as good as I expected, kind of tasteless....

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. menu
Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

hz6YNPnjuIM8Xao_W4p4Dw.text: This food is very very delicious and healthy in a laid back , fun environment..........and did I say delicious.   Employees could use to pay attention when people look lost walking in and confused on how it works I love the way it works but its unique and confusing if you're experiencing it for the first time Delicious Delicious Delicious

aBzpxVQBy7lTj3VnhT9Ovw.text: I love when a long standing restaurant keeps up the quality of their food. Penn Ave has consistently been at the top of my list for years. I truly think they have some of the freshest fish in the city.  This is honestly my go-to stop when in the strip (or close by, let's be honest). My main orders are the charashi bowl, spicy yellowtail and/or pretty girl roll. I don't stray too often. I know, creature of habit! They do have a rather large menu of sandwiches, salads and fish entrees. They also have a daily sushi special if you want to mix things up. I look at it as chef's choice. It's also BYOB and open for dinner, if you're looking for a casual night spot.   Just some tips. You order at the far left side of the counter, but pay after you have eaten. You can also grab whatever beverage you like from the two refrigerators.

9RxTiVVeUcpiU0RG1PGOrw.text: Fresh sushi, sashimi and raw oysters for a fair price. It's a casual place where you can also buy some frozen or fresh sea food. They also have salad bar at lunch times (never went for dinner) and also takos, sandwiches and much more. They have two different ambient: one more informal near the cashier and another one bigger (it's where you can find the salad bar and the restroom). I do recommend this place if you like seafood.

98gp1Wk_ELC7ABUmgYFu0g.text: Food was great! We actually went there by accident and decided to stay and eat there . I give the food 5 stars , the oysters were excellent ! The mussels were fantastic ! The soft crab dish was wonderful as well. The ambiance needs some work though , they really need to fix the place up since it's such a hole in the wall and also not having a liquor license isn't good either but Atleast it's byob. But if all you care about is the food then this is the place to really try out.

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Frontage

rZloS5jeshiI_yFszAs62g.text: This place is always good and fresh. This was my first time actually eating here. I normally come in for the fish to take home and cook. I came in for lunch one Friday afternoon. I sat a a table for awhile wondering why the wait staff wasn't coming to me so finally i went to the front counter where they told me I had to order with them first and they bring you the food. Duh! that is why the is a big menu on the wall to order...so heads up before you get there. I started off with a sushi appetizer

EIdgVlcdDzrqsThm8iPPKA.text: This was my first time to the Penn Ave Fish Company. My colleague and I went because she recommended it.   I ordered the English Style Cod which comes with coleslaw and potato chips. The fish was delicious and flaky especially covered with their tartar sauce. The potato chips were also good. I wasn't really a fan of their coleslaw.   The ambiance of the restaurant is pretty cool and I would love to go back in the spring/summer when the windows are all open.   Parking can be challenging so plan accordingly! Also remember to pay! You pay when you leave instead of when you order for some reason.

7zyhztnmzpH88gUyzKk4Jg.text: The quality of fish here was wonderful and the sushi also seemed like it was good quality.   My favorite menu item is probably the pretty girl roll. The different flavors in the roll work really well together. If you've never had sushi before, I feel like this is a good roll to start with.

Fjj9qVFMbNQDaBFSbbSLoQ.text: This is my favorite lunch spot in the strip. I love good seafood and the sandwiches, pizza and sushi are fabulous. My favorites have been the crab cake sandwich and blackened tilapia sandwich. I love that the space has been expanded and it is no longer so crowded which speaks to the great food served.

0M6WzZ20ZdtyPo-Ny00aGA.text: Penn Avenue Fish Company: Hook, Line, and Sinker When you think of Pittsburgh cuisine, you might not think of sushi and fresh fish. Sure, we've got three rivers, but the Mon isn't exactly the source of sushi grade tuna. And we're not living the Japanese life where you can munch on sushi from a vending machine...hmmm. So where can you go to quiet your craving for aquatic-dwellers? The Penn Avenue Fish Company has your back...or your stomach. The PAFC has two locations (the Strip District and Downtown). We've been to both locations, but we're always drawn back to the Strip location. Not only is the Penn Ave location where it all began, but the amount of stimuli in this place is unreal. Not only is it packed with patrons getting their eat on (it's always jammed at lunch), but the guys and gals who run this eatery are really working! If you look to the left, you'll see the fishmongers filleting up whole fish and wrapping up various fresh orders for the at-home cooks. In the center, is the sushi counter. Here you can sit and watch the sushi masters create art on a plate. Some of those rolls are almost too picturesque to eat...almost. At the front counter, people are jockeying for their turn to check out the chalkboard menu and place their orders. (Don't be surprised if Angela Earley, co-owner alongside Henry B. Dewey, writes your ticket herself.) This is also where you pay when you're done eating. Besides sushi, the regular menu ranges from sandwiches and tacos to pizzas and salads. They also have daily soups and specials. While you might have trouble deciding what you want, trust me when I tell you that everything is fresh and delicious. No matter what you pick, your mouth will be happy. One of my favorite sandwiches to order is ... To read my full review (including pics), please go to: fork2mouth.blogspot.com/...

vn1IIUv3DBvG54P7fuY-MA.text: Phenomenal sushi!  Penn Ave Fish Company is an amazing fish market with fabulous sushi!  I would recommend this to anyone!  The sushi was fresh and great prices!

2Pw4zmplfiN4Zw452LCabA.text: A seafood gem in pittsburgh surprisingly that is in my top 10 all time favourite seafood restaurants....it's relatively cheap around 8-15 a meal and it's not really a restaurant per say....more like you order at the counter and they bring it to you, limited seating, kind of like a seafood market where you can see all the fresh fish they have....too bad this place only opens from 9-4pm, will definitely come back to this place when I'm in town

Mgq4uGLFS4BNZcExkigIfw.text: I'm a big fan of the traditional fish sandwich.  Have rarely met one I don't like.  This place is not your traditional fish sandwich joint and they are great.  Salmon, tuna, etc., even fish tacos. And, in my opinion, the absolute best sushi in Pittsburgh.

s33VL5ha30E1bx52tJJycg.text: Super solid sushi, I say. How's that for truth through alliteration?!   The lovely Rachel C shuffled me here in just under an hour after my flight touched down in the 'Burgh. Clamoring for some food to shove into my hungry belly, I was mighty happy to spy a creative menu laden with sushi and fish delectables. After we claimed a table, we sauntered up to the counter to order the following: Flower roll, Pretty Girl roll, Spicy Senorita roll and seaweed salad.   As we waited for our influx of sushi we imbibed upon the delicious yet spicy bottled capsacin citrus beverages found in the cooler. If you're looking for a kick in the throat - get yourself a bottle. Back to the sushi - super delightful! My favorite was definitely the Pretty Girl roll, and this says a lot considering I'm typically not a salmon fan. The soy paper wrapped beautifully around the large, fresh hunks of salmon and avocado.   Also worth noting that the Spicy Senorita was a refreshing option added into the mix. Eating a tasty roll such as this makes me a little sad when I think of the tiny population of people who taste soap when they eat cilantro...they'll never know the goodness of a roll like the Spicy Senorita. Oh well, I guess I'll just eat their share.

NuTCLQWVG6rdQ_4RRry8QQ.text: Friday Lent food option.  Fish or crab sammie at PennAVFish, offering good service with the best and freshest seafood available.   Some good soup options.  Just order at the counter and wait for the scrumptious sammie, grab a drink out of the cooler and if you want some soup help yourself.  Sammie came with some slaw and a bean and green pepper salad that was delish.   Sushi available, too.  Took some fresh fish home for dinner.

yrwXdbr684zUohj559Kopw.text: You must try the smoked salmon. Yes, it's expensive. But it may be the best smoked salmon I've ever tasted. The texture makes a large part of the difference.

3B2ehaOu9epqODAGs3icEw.text: Good beer and solid sushi. I live in the Midwest and this place would be great for indy but not as good as Vancouver or Seattle. Love the service and the chalkboard and pbr vibe. Hipsters and families are welcome.

AZ48aYwVG8RIVmkevvolHA.text: Has the best nigiri that I've tasted. Get the salmon nigiri. Enjoy.

BVKaQ84b6-udiIHvIIiFXg.text: This is the best place to get seafood dishes in Pittsburgh. I love the sushi here and always get the pretty girl roll! It's really cute with the pink soy roll tehe. And I really like how open everything is so there's great lighting. The only complaint I have is that their hours can be pretty limited (or were the last time I went)!

DbVqYiEEbjBS9BBAhX9Ihw.text: Extremely good and fresh sushi at a reasonable price. I must warn in advance sushi lovers that the taste is very American, i.e. you'll find fantasy rolls of many sorts. But everything's very good and fresh, really, cool place, I'll come back if I'm ever back into Pittsburgh.

qeR_fZP20XehfGZ-tyIBsA.text: Now If you want a sandwich but you want to watch what you eat this is not the place you want to go to. If you see them make the sandwich you will not want to eat there for life there is fries everywhere lettuce mixed in with all the other toppings they don't have beer on draft so if you want draft then Otta luck it's is very unsanitary the food is good but not at the same time I would not recommend it to anyone

FtVISNpmJHhE3mvv7oMTDQ.text: As other reviewers have stated, Penn Avenue Fish Company has the best fish in the city. Bearing that in mind, it is also some of the most expensive fish in the city. I go here for fish when I need something perfect or want something special or if I'm making sushi at home (never skimp for sushi.)   They also have a casual order-at-the-counter lunchtime business. Once again, the prices are higher than a normal "fast food" lunch option, but the quality is top-notch. I like the fish tacos - 2 tacos make a generous lunch for me.

4O6Yxroxke2TY9o2RqeMjQ.text: I was FINALLY able to visit this place for their all-you-can-eat sushi wednesdays.  In addition to other specials like Taco Tuesdays, they offer this special on wednesdays from 11AM-2PM (this window of time, the cashier says, is created so that the sushi chefs have time to prepare and time to clean up and leave).  Taco tuesdays, however, are all day long, 9-4.  This review is for their sushi wednesdays only.  I'm fully convinced that this is probably my go-to place for sushi in pittsburgh before 4PM.  It's quite unfortunate that I can't enjoy their food for dinner.  My friend and I went around noon.  The cashier gave us each a form to fill out, indicating the rolls and nigiri that were available for the sushi wednesday special.  this menu is available on their website. as it also state on the website, one must be wary of their classification of AYCE. You are actually limited to 3 rounds.  First round: 2 nigiri (4 pieces total) and 2 rolls (11-12 pieces total).  First round must be finished before second round. Second round is the same, and third round is 2 nigiri and 1 roll.  This was definitely one of the fresher sushi fish I have tasted in Pittsburgh.  The salmon was average to good, and the yellowtail was awesomely tender.  one major, and i mean MAJOR, downfall of the meal overall was how tightly they packed the rice for the nigiri.  It was definitely bottom-of-the-ricepot rice, which accounted for its temperature, but the sushi chef put a death grip on this thing.  When i picked it up, the whole surface of the sashimi was glued onto the rice. when i bit into the rice, it felt like I was biting into packed refrigerated rice (which, if you don't know, is VERY hard).  It was excessively dense, and sort of destroyed the nigiri for me.  I tried to eat some of the rice to "finish" my plate, but I ended up leaving some of it under an expertly placed used napkin on the place.  Despite the nigiri, which was probably isolated to the work of one of the two working sushi chefs, the rolls were wrapped looser than most places, which I didn't mind at all.  I got through two rounds (they had accidentally given me round 1 and 3 first, before round 2), but by my last round, I could only finish 1/3 of my plate.  I took the fish out from my rolls, and off the rice, and I just ate the fish before leaving.  At 18 dollars (19.25 with tax, i believe), for all this sushi, this is a serious steal for pittsburgh sushi.  I can't wait to go back here again for sushi and to try their fish sandwiches, another one of my favorite foods.  5 stars for beating out the pittsburgh sushi places I have tried (Yokoso, Sushi Kim, Chaya, Taipei Inn (good for just rolls but pricey)) in the best balance of quantity and quality.  do see the pictures i uploaded of my round 1 and round 3 (with some fish leftover from round 2)

Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Round 1 of AYCE sushi Wednesday

xRODFeVdyY1im6272va8Bw.text: Best fish in the city hands down! Not sure why it took me so long to find this little gem. This place just recently expanded and there are more space to sit and enjoy sushi. Haven't gotten the chance to try their actual food besides sushi, but I believe it is just as good. Their service okay, it really depends on the fishmonger that is serving you.

1W2M11KAW5Qcomx1aRsEIA.text: Probably the best sushi I have EVER had in Pittsburgh! I have been countless times, and I have to admit I have even been twice in one day for lunch / dinner a few days in a row. I am not a fan of raw fish (but love sushi), but their Benny Roll and Green Dragon Roll are just AMAZING! I recommend this restaurant to anyone that is a fan of sushi. Their miso soup is also amazing - the chef makes his own miso and it just is always very nice and savory.

xXuY0aTwqxBForMB1x6JcA.text: One of my favorite places to eat in Pittsburgh. Very low-key. Don't plan on wearing a suit and tie to this joint. Probably some of the fresh sushi I've ever eaten. This rivals Vegas New York and San Francisco. Everything is made fresh. The soups are phenomenal and they always have a good selection. The sushi is absolutely amazing. And you can't mess with just their good old-fashioned fish sandwich. They recently expanded the restaurant so there's plenty of seating now. They also have a sushi bar we can sit out. The only downside is it is BYOB. All in all one of the best places to get seafood in Pittsburgh.

sRobEnbQz750UCl79QuypQ.text: I went here today for lunch (strip location) after hearing several close friends and family members rave about it.  I was not disappointed!  It's very small and casual.  You order at the counter and they bring the food to you - great for a quick, but delicious lunch.  Everything is very fresh, to the point where you can see them carving GIANT fish on the counter and shipments of new fish constantly rolling in!  (I think a server said they get shipments at least 3x a day.)  I honestly wanted everything on the menu, but went with a bowl of swordfish bisque and crab cake sliders (served on a pretzel roll - sold!!)  Both were delicious and I can't wait to go back!  Someone next to us was eating sushi and I will probably have to try that ASAP.  The staff was all very friendly and service was quick also.  Prices reasonable for the high quality fish served.    If you like fish, go here!

woJXXGQMVn6lMXwjypo9Hw.text: Their hours are supposed to be as follows. Called on twice on a Thursday around 5:00pm to place a pick-up order, and got their machine. They aren't even open when they're supposed to be. Really disappointing.  Monday-Tuesday: 9am - 4pm Wednesday-Friday: 9am - 8pm Saturday: 8am - 8pm ; Sunday: 10am - 2pm

WwSuipIFYvUdU_TVa6c9Hg.text: The mussels in tomato sauce were fresh, juicy, and excellent. The crab tacos are a delicious take on a traditional Baja fish taco, and the tuna in the tekka maki was some of the best I've tasted in the 'Burgh.

QzqmYeh-YzAuTiuHMm18aQ.text: An interesting combination of a seafood market and a seafood restaurant. I didn't buy anything from the market side, but the fish looked great. It seemed fresh, and the display was aesthetically appealing.   As for food, I ordered the Sanjaya Swordfish sandwich. I don't think the ingredients came together well as a sandwich. The swordfish was good even though it was completely cooked through. (Normally, I don't like my fish to be completely cooked through). The curry sour cream sauce was good too and would have made a nice compliment to the swordfish on its own. I don't think adding the grilled red onion, cilantro, and ciabatta was necessary. The latter three were good too individually too: the onion had a nice char, the cilantro was fresh, and the ciabatta was warm and soft. Unfortunately, I felt the latter three overwhelmed the swordfish, in turn, making it difficult to appreciate the fish.  Also, I liked the macaroni shell and pepper salad which came as a side with the sandwich.  I would definitely return to Penn Ave Fish but not for a sandwich. I'd probably try the fish tacos, try something from the sushi bar, or order some fish from the market side to take home.  Lastly, the ambiance is worth mentioning. Penn Ave Fish feels like a last-minute effort to sell anything fish related out of a garage...which is likely their intention. You can see the entirety of the kitchen, and patrons have to walk through the kitchen on their way to the restroom. The playlist is dark and included experimental artists such as Gorillaz. The whole experience is very raw.

IlBMMBWFnGeYmBXGRvUFjg.text: This place is probably my all time FAVORITE restaurant in the city. It boasts some of the freshest fish that I have ever had. The crab cake sandwich is my go - to. Barely any filler, fresh avocado, and spicy remoulade make this a stellar sandwich. They typically service sandwiches with a side of coleslaw or pasta salad. I don't typically enjoy coleslaw, but I enjoy theirs! If you are a fan of sushi, I recommend the Spicy Senorita Roll. The jalapeno really gives it a kick which accompanies nicely with the cool taste that sushi provides. Anything you order on this menu - you cannot go wrong. The atmosphere is equally as awesome as the food, as it is a True fish market. The bright colors and good music make it a great place to stop and enjoy lunch.

_62Ytk-qqoym8DAOSU5Wsg.text: Food was great!  We had the pan seared calamari, the green dragon roll, the mini tacos, and the Sea Bass dinner.  All fantastic!  Portions: the green dragon roll is big, the fish tacos are small, the calamari is big, and the sea bass is just right

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mini fish tacos!

GQk_p7bFRp_DsyOmznmUXA.text: It's hard to miss this fish market/eatery, right in the middle of the strip. It's not often that you come across an indoor fish market selling the most exquisite varieties of fish and other seafood, and also housing a cool and casual looking restaurant with an interesting seafood inspired menu. I was really looking forward to eating here, but the experience was far from anything I was hoping for. Sitting in the midst of a fresh fish market, I had high expectations about the quality of seafood I would be served. The high yelp ratings only fueled my expectations further. I ordered a lobster roll sandwich on a pretzel bun, and my husband went with the Smoked salmon Benedict. Maybe, I just ordered the wrong thing...I now see that most yelpers have not enjoyed their lobster sandwiches a lot, wish I had read the reviews earlier. Well, to their credit, the food did come out pretty fast. The smoked salmon benedict looked nice and my husband seemed to enjoy it. But the lobster sandwich was quite a disgrace. Did I mention that I love lobsters? I found it hard to believe that someone could go wrong with lobster rolls/sandwiches. All you need is some good lobster meat and bread, maybe a dollop of butter as an added bonus. The lobster meat itself wasn't probably bad in this sandwich, but you could hardly taste it because it was mixed with other things. And if you want to serve a lobster-slaw kind of filling instead of pure lobster meat, you should probably add some spices and seasoning to it, at least some salt for starters. The dry, over-toasted pretzel bun with no butter/cheese/mayo/mustard did not help either. The side of fresh fruit was probably the only redeeming feature of this meal. Such a letdown! Please do not go for the lobster roll here, even if you love lobsters as much as I do. I'm sure the other things on their menu are much better..I myself would like to try their sushis based on all the great reviews.

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Smoked salmon Benedict
Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster  roll  sandwich on a pretzel  bun

KB-Aq36D0QZOYTCZsP_6sg.text: Definite yes from me. If you're out of town and visiting, or you just hadn't had a chance to try this place out, take my word for it....give it a try. The seafood here is really fresh and they certainly know how to season and cook just to perfection. Even with the large space, practically  all seating was taken. It's very busy inside with lots of movement and noise. There is a slightly claustophobic feeling in the first main dining area as it's really close to the entrance and regsiter. But, keep in mind, it is a large location with different eating areas. You may have to wait a little to be seated but you also have the option of sitting right outside. On the other hand, service at register was a little frosty but keep in mind, it's very busy and I do think they try to get things moving as fast as possible. Ciara who was our "server/waitress" was super friendly and an absolute delight to talk to.They have a great selection of organic/natural drinks. We ordered a selection of sushi and the salmon salad. Perfect portions and presentation was really appealing. All around freshness. Wait wasn't long. We are definitely coming back here. Side note. Dress code is casual, or whatever you feel best in and they have a "honor and pay" system. Which I thought was pretty quirky and cool. Great place. Definite thumbs up.

_2rxWkzoD8NeqWFc_t0XyQ.text: You wouldn't think it but Penn Ave Fish Company is a great place for a casual quickish dinner if you are craving seafood/sushi. I've always come for lunch but made the suggestion to my husband to try for dinner since he had never been. They closed at 8pm on Sat. You can either order at the counter like during lunch or you can request to be served at a table. We ordered a bunch of sushi to share - green dragon, benny and sexy senorita. The rolls were awesome! Service has always been friendly and prompt - they accommodated our request to have the cilantro on the side for the sexy senorita. BYOB and allowed us to keep our beers in the fridge. Once you're done you pay at the counter just like at lunch time. The nice thing about coming here for dinner is that the Strip isn't as crazy as during the day so street parking is easier. We will be back and my husband loved his experience here!

MqiUOWsj0_JzmVEX-XHxnA.text: Ordered crab and fish tacos. Weird taste, no real flavor, lack of salt. Both tacos tasted the same. Disappointing.

H2BKyCxX-Cf6Kp9aw5gG8w.text: I ordered takeout from here last weekend. The food was average but the service was lousy. It was my first time ordering from there so I looked up the menu online. I didn't see any of the sides listed, so when ordering my meal (crab cake sandwich) I asked the person over the phone what their side options are. This is how the convo went:   Me: What sides do you have? Her: Well what would you want? Me: What are my options? Her: Well you can tell me what you want and I'll tell you if we can make it.  Me: Okay.. uh.. do you have french fries of some sort? Her: No. We fry nothing here. Me: Never mind, I'll just take the sides that it comes with.   Seriously?? You couldn't even put in the effort to make a suggestion? It was really bizarre, not to mention annoying. The food wasn't good enough for me to rush back.

QGoOmUGLqYi4SminZtnKIQ.text: I want to give Penn Avenue Fish Company 5 stars and before Saturday night I would have... We have been there a number of times for the Oyster Happy Hours during the week and loved it. Emphasis on the lov-ed, as in past tense.  Saturday we went with a  large group and things seemed very off.  They were prepping for a  private party in the newer section of the restaurant so seating was limited.  The staff pulled together tables for us and although the service was slow we didn't complain.  It was a great time.  I mean who wouldn't be happy eating fresh oysters and other seafood while hanging out with some of your favorite people on earth.  All the joy ended when it was time to pay the bill.  The system to order and pay did not serve us well.  Even though each of us ordered separately and received our orders individually at the end of the night the waitress said we still owed them for 48 oysters.  It is hard to miss eating 4 dozen oysters and no we did not order them.  The only thing I can imagine is that someone else ordered 4 dozen oysters and it ended up on our bill.    It was an insult to say we lied about what we ordered and ate. I am still in shock over the entire episode.  I have never encountered anything like this in my years 50 years and I eat out a lot.  It is unfortunate as I could have seen myself and my friends going here weekly but it is hard to swallow what happened and there really isn't any way to ensure that it won't happen again..    My advice is steer clear if they are extremely busy and keep your oyster shells until you pay to prove how many you ate or you might end up in the same boat as us dishing out cash for food that you didn't order or receive.    My recommendation to Penn Ave Fish Company is close early or post something on your website if you close down half the restaurant we could have found another place to dine and you would still have high standing in our book. A lot of reviews talk about the confusion caused by the system to order and pay... it is a shame that cannot be fixed.  .

38rC_WK6l0ambfp_uSW8eA.text: The good: The food was tasty and the flavors were right on. I had the fish tacos to start and the halibut as the main course. Overall it was a good meal. The service was fine and our waitress was pretty good at keeping up with us.  The bad: The portions were rather lackluster. The sides that came with the main course were tiny and the halibut was good but not satisfying. I could have had another piece. Also, when I made the reservation I asked if the lunch menu would still be available during dinner service and was told it would be (our reservation was for 6 PM). But when I asked for lunch options our waitress said that they were out except for the tacos and another item. She told us this happens often. I wish they would have told me this when making the reservation a week prior. They were even out of the soups and bisque, which was disappointing.   Overall I would try this place again, but more likely to shoot for lunch. For $30+ for a dinner I kind of expect to be satisfied and not wanting more. I stop eating a meal after feeling somewhat full and I was nowhere near that after the fish tacos and halibut, so my friends and I decided to walk to Primanti's and have a sandwich, we were still that hungry.
