xbh_IXGwiPicwTF3wHPyCw.text: I've had some good stuff here and some not so good stuff. They go waaaay heavy on the old bay. Wish they'd clean the tables a little better and faster than they do. I love their sushi and I've had some of the. Eat oysters ever there but I don't recommend the crab cakes.

HLU1Df8DGU4BHTLBvAvjxA.text: Had the sneaky Pete.  Amazing.  Salmon perfectly cooked.  Would recommend definitely.  I would eat there three times a day.

D276IS4N5NuMS3QG44vEpw.text: I ordered an avocado roll and some daisy duke jean shorts wearing server brought me a salmon roll. I told her that's not what I ordered and she said "so you don't want it?" I said no and she cracked her gum at me and stormed away. Service? Well that wasn't it...  Fox news on the tv?!?!? That takes one star off right there for making the whole establishment and patrons UNCOMFORTABLE because that station promotes hate which makes EATING there unpleasant.  The prices make it fee like a tourist trap because the amount of food the price doesn't add up.  Of course I/we didn't realize this until after we order a cod sandwich (and the above roll) which was ok. Why does everything around this city look like you went to a garage sale to provide the furnishings?  The fish was ok. The atmosphere? Generic and nothing special.  All of these reasons are why we didn't like it here and would advise other open minded people to maybe look for a better fish option in the greater Pittsburgh area.

pcCrh4oNaB2UE-fAIujTFw.text: Very unwelcoming atmosphere and sub-par service. The employees seemed more concerned with their personal conversations while they sipped on wine and lounged against the counter than they were with acknowledging customers presence. I watched in disbelief as the attendant at the counter had a personal conversation with a customer that she appeared to know for nearly 12 minutes as there was literally a line accumulating out the door. (I'm all for a little small talk, and a relaxed atmosphere but this was excessive.) My order of one simple salmon roll to go took over 30 minutes and no one checked on me until I got up to give up and walk out, the woman then claimed she had called my order out but mispronounced my name, but considering I was watching her chat it up the whole time I know that to be a blatant lie.  The sushi was not bad, average, and the price was very fair. The food smelled fresh and I'm sure had I been more adventurous than salmon it would have been great. Anyway: I won't be going back.

iSFRY8Njhgav5kx5rELbVQ.text: Best sushi in pgh IMO. As soon as you walk in Penn Ave. Fish Co. You can tell you are in for something special! The men working there look like they just walked off a boat from an episode of the deadliest catch. Fresh fish is everywhere you look being packed on ice and sliced for consumption. The smell fills the air and adds to the already amazing experience.   The specials are a must. If they have it as a special, chances are it is delicious. I almost always get whatever the special is. Sometimes it's a sandwich, sometimes it's a pizza but all of the time it's absolutely delicious!   Next comes the sushi!!! You will not go wrong ordering sushi here. I have eaten sushi all over pittsburgh and let me just tell you this is some of the best. The rolls are fatter, tastier and just all around better than anywhere else!   Sunday is all you can eat fish taco bar. Always have great specials. Staff is also very attractive. Hello ladies! What more can you say!? A+

rZI4-ayeXsLQxTc8e8EoOg.text: When ordering I was very overwhelmed by the menu options but the friendly staff helped me choose from the menu. I couldn't eat my food fast enough. Between my husband and I, we ordered the seafood bisque soup, crab tacos, clams, and a salmon "energy" plate. Every item was amazing.   When it was time to pay for our order we only ended up spending $36. I could not believe we paid so little for quality seafood. If I lived in Pittsburgh, I would definitely visit often. What a gem!

LYny9arkW2ZX_r3ful2o3Q.text: As first-time visitors to Pittsburgh, we stopped by here for lunch on our final day of a weekend-long trip. BEST CHOICE WE COULD HAVE MADE. As a seafood lover, I was careful not to hold my expectations too high for land-locked Pitt. Turns out, I had nothing to worry about. I think I shed a little tear. It could have been the hunger, too.  The sushi is fresh. The special of the day gave us a good variety of high-end pieces of fish--score! The ingredients swordfish tacos and crab tacos, from the meat to toppings were also amazingly fresh (I consider myself a bit of a fish taco connoisseur, thank you very much), with the hard shell winning over the soft shell. The tacos also came with this homemade chipotle sour cream, a perfect complement!  At the end of our meal, we decided to check out the fish market side of PAFC and saw that they were selling sea urchin (uni--might be an acquired taste for some!). We inquired about the price and found out that they sold for about $12 a head, including gutting and cleaning right there. We watched out tattooed fishmonger delicately peel and scoop out the roe and place six perfectly formed pieces onto a piece of lettuce in a takeout box. Unable to resist, we ate them on the spot, enthralled at the fresh, quality flavors.  I envy you Pittsburgh-ians!

LBLohNF4-Y2tXUuos5hBcQ.text: We had an outstanding meal at PAFC last night! The fish was super-fresh and well-prepared. The service was excellent. And, our fellow diners were  friendly and delightfully eclectic....from baseball stars to talented glass artists (Sam Foreman)!

AbURZv8eu-w3qDagDvRCoA.text: Some of the best fish/seafood in town.  The salmon sandwiches are always good. Tried their crab cake as well.  My wife had their sashimi and she loved it.   In terms of grabbing seafood to eat in the Strip, there is Penn Ave Fish Company, Luke Wholey's restaurant, and Robert Wholey dinning place.  Out of the three, I like Penn Ave Fish Company for their freshness (especially raw fish). Robert Wholey has the deep-fry oyster and soft-shell crabs, but Penn Ave Fish Company certainly has some healthier options.

-XSelglMyH4preQJ_LFUoA.text: On my first tour of Pittsburgh, my boyfriend took me to The Strip district. We walked around and planned on eating lunch in the area, so we decided on Penn Ave Fish Co. Upon entering, the atmosphere is a little confusing because the restaurant is split into two sections with various counters within each one.   We just walked to the closest counter and the menu there seemed good, so we quickly placed and order and grabbed drinks in the nearby coolers. I got the seared tuna club sandwich and he got three fish tacos.   Soon enough, our orders were brought to our table next to the register. The crusty ciabatta bread for the club sandwich was so good and the tuna was cooked perfectly. The second layer of the double-decker sandwich had strips of bacon, lettuce and tomato on it. My boyfriend's fish tacos were not the typical fried-fish kind. They had assorted chopped fish in a heavily-spiced taco sauce, which I wasn't the biggest fan of. We traded condiments. He ate his tacos with my side of coleslaw, and I used his spicy mayo with my sandwich.  My sandwich also came with a side of mediterranean chickpea and rice salad, which we were both big fans of. A great lunch idea to DIY!

ydx4_l70rtRjm81D3DDyiw.text: Penn Ave is one of my favorite spots in town.  I HIGHLY recommend the fish tacos.  You can't go wrong with a roll either.  The service is quick and the food is always fresh and delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Never a bad experience at Penn Ave!

7goWq8WP7Ctyk6MJh69Cjw.text: SETTING: It's like eating inside a fish market! Cool decorations that followed a sea life theme. Random tables dispersed in sectioned areas.   FOOD: So I hear this place has the freshest fish in Pittsburgh? I'm not going to argue with that statement. I saw fish being carted around, iced, and cut. It all happens in house on the one side where you can buy fish by the pound.   We went with the Green Dragon Roll and Fish Tacos. The Green Dragon Roll consisted of shrimp tempura, eel and crab, and avocado.  It wasn't anything special compared to sushi joints I've been to elsewhere (outside of Pittsburgh), but I would say that it's one of the better quality rolls here. Solid roll, no complaints.  Fish Tacos was the main reason I wanted to come here. I'm used to beer-battered fish tacos, so I was excited to try the non-battered version. The Fish tacos consisted of a mix of swordfish, salmon, and tuna in a hard or soft taco shell (your choice) topped with cabbage, cilantro salsa, sriracha. The fish were well seasoned and soft. And they did not skimp on the fish either! Mixed well with the other ingredients, the tacos were packed with flavor. Size was appropriate too. What's not to like!   SERVICE: Little to none. You order up front at the register and then find a seat. I was confused because I did not get a receipt (you don't pay until after you finish eating) or a number or anything! I didn't know how the staff would know who ordered what and where we were sitting. I was more than a little confused and felt there was a holdup because of this system.  It all worked out though. The girl who took our order brought out our food. Then after we cleaned our plates, we went up to pay for it. Of course, we had to tell them what we ordered because there was no previous documentation. I don't know why the transactions are done this way...doesn't seem the most efficient, but hey, they've been doing this for a while and if it works for them, then it works.   IMPRESSIONS: Like a previous yelper pointed out, this place is a bit confusing for the first time visitor. The layout, the ordering, the paying. It's not a big deal now I know how they roll, maybe I just sea things a little differently. But now that I have experienced the delicious seafood, I'm as happy as a clam :).   I would definitely come back though. I am very very wary about eating sushi/raw fish at restaurants in Pittsburgh because I don't know how fresh they are. I mean, I know restaurants that serve fish aren't getting theirs from the Allegheny River, so it must be supplied by a place further out. This is why I always thought the fish in Pittsburgh might not be the most fresh. But at Penn Ave Fish Co? I trust them.   Next time, I'll take a little risk and go raw. I want to try the sashimi!

TSw09Jww6nk-Hh-pQ62QMQ.text: Hands down best sushi is Pittsburgh. The fish is super fresh and the entire operation is super smooth. I ordered 3 rolls for lunch to go, and my order was ready in less than 10 minutes. I got eel avocado, salmon avocado and spicy tuna avocado. I will absolutely return for dinner and can't wait to try their spicy tuna melt which looks epic!

2lrXyCeIyzNutU71EP6ejA.text: Yeah!!!!  My favorite part of dining here, which I did today for the first time, was that some woman walked in and said, "It smells fishy in here, that's not good for sushi," and I turned to her and said, "There is a man filleting a giant salmon right behind you," and then she turned around and was like, "oh."  I had Sushi maki combo #2, California Rolls and Avocado rolls, and an Arancita, and it was $10.00.  You cannot find a better $10 lunch in the Strip District, and if you think you can you are entitled to your wrong opinion.  I loved their sushi!  It was really good.  Like really, really good.  I will def be back and I don't know why I wasn't here sooner.

3dorU5-GjGPuPQqIAbhiEw.text: Great little eatery in the Strip District. The Tuna Club was fresh and flavorful. The coleslaw and pasta salad were a perfect addition, and added just enough interest to the meal. Great amount of food. Went here for dinner on a Saturday night and headed out for drinks after in Millvale.

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tuna Club

Z2dlUXMNGVrKpfh42zyBwA.text: Delicious and fresh! We tried the crab tacos and spicy tuna melt. Both were incredibly yummy. The tuna melt was spicy with the jalapenos and siracha and I think we both broke a sweat on a bite or two, but overall excellent. The crab tacos were our favorite and the bean and rice salad served with the sandwich was fabulous. We also had a pretty girl sushi roll which was very fresh and tasty too. Overall, we enjoyed our selections and would go back in a heat beat.

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. sushi
Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spicy tuna melt and delicious rice and bean salad
Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Inside

ypH1mMrueg_kQfPlGXiDiw.text: Popped into here on a Thursday evening with my gal pal before heading off to a Yelp event. I was pretty excited to visit after hearing great things about it and seeing that their prices in mostly land locked PA were under $10/item. You know I like a good value for my food dollar, so I was pumped.   Once you get past the overwhelming stank of fish, this place grows on you. Ordering at the counter is a breeze and the food came out quickly, but perhaps because we were only one of three other tables there. I wanted to try the soup but they were sold out so I went with just two fish tacos. I didn't eat the tortillas but the fish was excellent, even if it was a little too oily. It was fresh and not old tasting and came with a good pico on top. I'm told they have a taco Tuesday special at a discounted rate. What I also loved is that these weren't trendy (aka miniscule) tacos, they were standard sizing. The waitress/cashier was friendly and helpful when I was choosing what to get. My friend loved her tempura shrimp sushi. The pieces in her roll were big and came 6 per order.   This place has definitely become a little gem along Penn Ave. I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fish counter
Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fish tacos
Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Storefront

iiZCyIB9Bb01Fze7d8mt9g.text: Every time  I come back to town to visit, I make sure I go to lunch at Penn Ave. Fish Company. I am typically pretty limited with the variety of foods that I like, but here I have eaten so many things from the menu, all of which have been worth a return visit. There are so many options, the ambiance is great for lunch, and everything I have eaten has been fresh.

NrTOrUqoVnWK1wfYbdkRQQ.text: Part market, part restaurant, and both work so well together. Not only is the fish fresh as can be, but the prices are quite reasonable for the exceptionally high level of quality.  Next visit, I'll be BYOB (or wine, or sake), as they don't serve alcohol, but have no problem with patrons bringing in their own beverages.

HAZ4lQ4hEWs_uQ2BaQDfTg.text: Full disclosure: I'm not a seafood person at all. I've been to Penn Ave downtown once before, but a group of friends decided to pick Penn Ave in the strip for a dinner date night. It didn't disappoint! I did some research so that I was able to choose a more mild fish. I decided to order the Seasoned Tilapia sandwich which came on ciabatta bread with cheddar cheese. My girlfriend and I also split a spicy tuna roll which was very tasty. Both were absolutely delicious. The service was really awesome as we had about 12 bottles of wine for them to open (BYOB!). I highly recommend coming here, and I'll definitely be back to try something else!

t37bvxSWNmPhLOgs9uzaFg.text: I can't stop raving about how awesome this place is! First of all, the place is unpretentious and chill. (Sometimes you just want good sushi without having to go to a fancy Japanese restaurant.) The location is also great for a pre-theater dinner. I went on a Wednesday night with two friends before a musical, and we had pretty fast service. (It wasn't very busy.)  I got the Lollipop roll, which is salmon, tuna, and crab wrapped with cucumber --delicious and super healthy. My only complaint is that at $13, I wish I would've gotten more than five pieces because I was still hungry afterwards. It was so good though, I'm still giving this place five stars. I ended up also ordering a Green Fuji Roll ($6), which is salmon, avocado, and scallions. It was also scrumptious.   I want to go back and have more sushi and give their fish sandwiches a try. I've never seen such an exciting fish sandwich menu. There's such a variety and they all sound good. Creative, but not trying to hard to be creative that the dish might not be tasty. I'm actually excited about almost everything on the menu, and definitely plan to visit again soon!

94t1-RhlI0gdIh_kdBj_GA.text: I've been trying to get to Penn Ave Fish Company for Taco Tuesday for months.  Since I had Christmas Eve off, I decided to try it out with a friend.  Unfortunately, on and near major holidays they aren't able to do taco Tuesday or have a full kitchen running.  They do still have sushi, though!  Plus, they do a FIERCE business with people picking up fish.  And after eating the sushi, I would eat and purchase anything here.  I believe in starting with a California Roll at every establishment.  It's my baseline for comparing sushi.  I broke my own rule a little, and I went with a spicy California roll.  It was, hands down, the best one I've ever had.  The fish was SO fresh.  I mean, SO fresh.  The spicy was perfect, and I have been craving another ever since.  Plus, there are so many other awesome options (some traditional and some unique).  My friend loved his speciality roll and demolished the whole thing.   I can't wait for my next Tuesday off to try taco Tuesday!  I know everyone else has already said it, but this is hands down the best sushi in PIttsburgh.  It's some of the best sushi I have ever eaten.  Get here ASAP!

z5Xg0fNjD4LBcIOmSK8Asg.text: I've been on a quest to find really good sushi in Pittsburgh since I've been here about a year and a half and I have been pretty disappointed in the offerings in the city (after living in several coastal cities prior to this).    But now I have finally found what I was looking for in Penn Ave Fish Company!   For some reason I had the impression this was a more fancy pricey restaurant so it took me awhile to finally make it down here.  But it's more like a market style casual restaurant where you order at the counter and they bring it to your table.  You can also buy fish in their market to-go though their market selection is much smaller than Wholley's.    My friend and I shared a few sushi rolls and split the fish tacos. The fish tacos, which were a combo of swordfish, tuna and salmon, were amazing. The best I've every had.  And I've had some pretty damn good fish tacos when traveling in Southern Cali or Florida.  Then the sushi rolls were so fresh and amazing with generous portions of fish.  I saw a guy there working on butchering a very large tuna so I know their fish is some of the freshest you can get in Pittsburgh.  Also everything was so affordable and inexpensive!  I will definitely be going back here regularly.

uCioSIwia73v35yONJlaRA.text: Coming from Seattle, I was a bit skeptical to try fish from Pittsburgh. Sushi especially seemed ambitious for a place with far less Asians. Serious fish withdrawal prompted me to throw caution to the wind, however, and I found myself at Penn Ave.   These guys know their fish. If you plan on ordering several rolls, expect to wait a bit (there is only one sushi chef - at least on Sundays). I promise you it is well worth the wait. The sushi man puts so much love and care into these. We ordered 5 rolls. All were excellent. Our favorites were the Bennie and Ron. The tempura in both added some extra crunch.  I've come to the conclusion that Pittsburgh has better sushi than Seattle. This is crazy.  I'm working my way to regular status at Penn Ave. You should too.

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Flower, BLT, Ron, Pretty girl, and Bennie rolls

e74fBbi12d-u9h6dzBXegA.text: Best sushi ever!!! Everything is soooo fresh! I want to try something new every time I go! I love their crab from the crab cake sliders on the softest pretzel bun you ever had to the crab melt!   Check out the apparel section it's so pretty :)  I love the atmosphere everyone behind the counter looks like they just step foot on dry land.

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crab cake slider

pV3MMskaCud4MIMeOcn-Nw.text: My favorite and go to for sushi in Pittsburgh.  I'm really picky and actually gave up sushi for my first year living in Pittsburgh because the quality of fish sort of sucks here (only really eat sushi and sashimi when I'm home in California or in NYC).  However, I had a really bad craving and finally gave Penn Ave a shot.  Worth it. So worth it. Good portions, prices were good, and service is excellent.  I also buy sashimi grade fish here whenever I want to make poke and sushi at home.  Only thing that's a bit weird is that they have lettuce in some of their rolls (and some other weird combinations)... but it's Pittsburgh, so I just accept it.  I just order it without and they'll accommodate, which is nice.

X7Xit81Yym4SBZbEiXId6Q.text: Awesome seafood. Came here with a date on a Saturday afternoon after walking the Strip all afternoon. We crossed this place and saw $1 oysters and couldn't pass up the deal, I think the happy hour starts at 4pm.   Place is pretty hipster and typical for a seafood market/counter: metal/wood chairs and table; fishing poles/ hooks/ bouy; concrete flooring; clean seafood smell; overall casual set-up.  We ordered the oysters, mussels, and some sushi. The oysters were shucked well and tasted clean. I didn't bother to ask where they were from, but they were good and the cocktail sauce was good as well. The mussels were decent but certainly could have been better; they actually smelled a little fishier than we're used to, however the preparation was tasty with a tomato-based sauce. We ordered a couple rolls and they were also good.   The service was attentive but not too overbearing. Be sure to grab a bottle of water next to the cash register after you order if you're planning on eating there.   Overall, definitely would recommend this place for some good eats and fresh seafood. I'll definitely be coming back next time around.

gF2dAslGOHEz79MPF9VDOw.text: What an awesome place! It was super bustling. Fish taco Tuesdays are probably the best thing I've ever experienced in my life.... Swordfish, salmon and tuna??? All you can eat for $9???? I would tear this place apart every Tuesday if I didn't live 4 hours away. Sighhh. The tacos were. Amazing. Best I've ever had.  I had the special another Wednesday, and I wasn't TOO impressed by the smoked salmon egg salad sandwich. The Mexican rice was pretty good, but the coleslaw and sandwich itself...mehh... for the price I paid for the amount of salmon...mehh... If I were to come to this place ONLY for fish tacos... they would get 5 stars hands down.  Anyway, I love the decor--hanging seafood everywhere, pretty cool tshirts on sale... minty chocolate at the checkout counter (yum). PS I love that you get your food and eat first then pay. Pretty trippy, right????  Parking...I think it's about luck...both times I've been there we got spots almost right in front. but I can't imagine parking at peak times?? (Especially because it was crappy weather both times we went...in the middle of the day)  Haven't had a chance to try the sushi/sashimi yet, but will definitely do that next time I hit up Pitt or go anywhere near....!

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Smoked salmon and egg salad sandwich with Mexican rice and Cole slaw...yum!

ADjuQZgMi_GDZ-4rbIuI8A.text: So many varieties of seafood! The menu is filled with a lot of mouth watering options from sandwiches, salads, pizza, to sushi, but I went with a Lunch Sashimi platter with 3 of each type (fluke, tuna, salon, octopus, and crab) and a Fantasy Roll (tuna, avocado, caviar). It was super fresh and melt-in-your-mouth texture. My dad ordered oysters, which were just as yummy and fresh; no strange odors that you get from not-so fresh seafoods. And the mussels that my mom ordered were divine.   The only thing is that the sushi seems a tad expensive, but for seafood this fresh, I think it's worth it. Will come here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Penn Ave Fish Company - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sashimi and Fantasy Roll

kjfhKlRKUsTMVXeiDW8IPA.text: i've been living in pittsburgh now for almost a week and have had dinner out a few times.  and sadly, i haven't been terribly impressed with the food scene thus far.  so i head over to yelp to see what gets good reviews and stumble across penn ave fish co.    **disclosure**  after living in miami for the past 9 years and living in various other cities on the east coast before that, i was troubled by the idea of fish in pittsburgh.  there should be a term for this... coastal fish elitist?    so, i have to admit that i was a bit reluctant to try penn ave fish company.  but man, oh man i'm soooo glad we went.  we've even been back twice already. once for sushi and crabcake sliders.  the sushi was ridiculously fresh and crabcake sliders on pretzel buns were to die for.  on trip #2... the grilled tuna club was a seriously scrumptious sandwich, uber fresh and a healthy size.  penn ave fish has been the highlight of our eating excursions so far.  even if you're a visiting 'coastal fish elitist', give it a go... i would be shocked if you're disappointed.

yY3oyKOxphEB3eE8BNuiYA.text: 3.5 from all of the great reviews, I expected something better but was unfortunately let down.

Ynfi7fpzJs1zJv7V0wKJFw.text: Had lunch with friend. Had sushi, which was good, but not out of the ordinary. Noisy, busy atmosphere that was funnish. Menu had interesting alternatives to sushi that are worth checking out. Will go back to do that. Worth checking out if you are in the Strip.

i-SfXZvBM0ZxGm44kiF7bw.text: Fresh fish, fresh n healthy preparations, good variety of seafood from sushi, to sandwiches to salads, all pretty good. We love to go there wish parking was a lil better and they were open later.

ZIPzbcBdz1SSR6FKLVqUDQ.text: I haven't been here for lunch, but I attended a private evening party at the restaurant.  Chef Henry Dewey knows his seafood, and is a master in the kitchen!  We sampled several seafood dishes, all cooked to perfection, with imaginative combinations of ingredients and seasonings.   Wonderful!!!

7YYvxaFeGo9HStSBeqW4Vg.text: Our greete who turned out to be the waitress was very rude from the get go. It didn't help that you felt rushed when the menu was given. When we asked her an opinion between two dishes she didn't bother at all. The food was ok and not the best seafood i've had. I've been at cheaper places that served better. The sushi also tasted spicy and we tried over 4 different dishes. Would not waste my time / money over here again.

itMonLAKV9Y9tz6dpICD1Q.text: Kat and Aaron did such a good job describing this place I don't know that I have too much to add.  I had lunch here today and even dealt with the craziness of the strip on a Saturday because I wanted to try a new sushi place.  The atmosphere is very "yelpy",,, new word let's all start using it.  I'll defer to Aaron's review for good detail on the space itself.  I walk up to the counter and order the sashimi lunch and also a couple fish tacos.  I placed my order and took a seat.  I'm guessing this place would be okay if you byob for a saturday lunch beer, but I didn't try it.  The fish tacos come out first and they have a great slaw with them and a delicious spicy sour cream type dip to put on the tacos.  The fish is grilled and not fried.  I actually prefer the fish to be lightly fried a la San Diego style.  The taco is piled high with cabbage, cilantro and salsa.  It looks great.  I bite into the taco and sadly the fish is meh'.  It's a mix of overcooked less than fresh tasting salmon and tuna I'd guess.  I'm a bit surprised and a little disappointed.  Then the sashimi arrives.  It's a big lunch portion with a really good variety of beautiful fish.  There are three nice sized pieces of tuna, salmon, octopus, yellowtail and I think something else.  It's cut perfectly and is melt in your mouth delicious.  The wasabi and ginger are also spot on.  This is the best quality sushi I've had outside of UMI in pittsburgh and it's a hell of a lot less.  It was only $9.50 for this large portion of beautiful fish.  Just as a point of comparison I was at umi the other day and got maybe a tablespoon serving worth of fatty tuna for almost $20.  I will frequent here often for this good deal.  I'll chalk up the fish tacos to my fault for coming after the lunch rush when the fish had time to overheat.  The only other thing is that I'm not sure about the tip situation.  I mean the girl brought me my food, but that was about it.  I placed order at the counter and grabbed my own drink etc,,.  I noticed most didn't leave anything I left about 10 - 15%.  Go for a cheap great quality sashimi lunch you won't be disappointed.

lq8kpvmDsHupOBONXN7iIA.text: food is solid.  have had the sneaky pete, fish tacos, tuna salad sandwich (not great, barely an upgrade from mayo and chicken of the sea), various soups, and plenty of sushi.  fish is very fresh most of the time.  i mainly eat at the newer downtown location. sushi rice is not mixed to my expectations.  maybe missing some rice vinegar or something.  regardless, it's noticeably missing something to me.    my main complaint is with the staff.  cashier women are arrogant and unprofessional.  the whole blakcberry thing is annoying, but the attitude is worse. i also believe there is some shady (ok, maybe it's fishy...) business going on with the staff.  i often use cash to buy my food.  i often do not get a receipt and the "tax" is rounded (estimate) up to the next whole dollar amount.  it's not every time, but it happens often enough.  either someone is ripping off the owners or the business is ripping off the government.  oh yeah, i get gipped a few pennies too.  i know it happens in many businesses, but that is something that bothers me.

9pEdCdugZPageRUXHdzP9A.text: Excellent and fun place to lunch in the Strip.  Visiting from New York City, I was skeptical of a seafood restaurant in the lovely but inland city of Pittsburgh. But I was pleasantly surprised, as the place lived up to its rep.  Interesting setup too: you go up, order, they bring you the food, you pick drinks out of the fridge, and then when you're all done you go up and tell them what you had . . . kind of an honor system (which I'm not sure would work in NYC).  Anyway, the food was simple but very good.  I had a lobster bisque and a blackened snapper sandwich, both of which were excellent. My daughter had mussels with tomato basil sauce, which was also very good.  One thing I don't get is that a majority of items on the menu are served with melted cheese . . . maybe it's me but seafood + cheese: yuck. Anyway, I suppose one could ask to hold the cheese.  It's a fun place in a great neighborhood, the people are nice and the food is very good.

FPoQml12cFFusrzREDbx_w.text: This place is my favorite lunch place in the Strip (and arguably the city).  There are SO many awesome options: sushi, pizza, sandwiches, tacos,...everything that I've tried has been delicious.  It does tend to get crowded, especially during the week.  I also REALLY wish they were open on Sundays and nights (though am very excited they are open nights during lent).
